Reviews.Title: “Trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Jill B
Reviews.Content: At wind chimes inn be aware of a few things its nice safe location only one block from the beach and close walking distance to the bus stop ( 2 blocks) and restaurants are about a 4 to six blocks away. If you like laying on the beach the sand is clean there are beautiful palm trees that provide nice shading however this part of the beach is not good for swimming there is a very rough current and high waves. There are a couple of great little cafes close to the bus stop, which is great because the buses really follow no schedule. Look for the sign that is all green and says parada its only 75 cents one way. The bus doesn't make change so be sure and ask your hotel clerk wherever you stay which one stops at your hotel and which to come back on. Taxi service is always available but, is a total rip off. Learn to find your way around on the bus you will save TONS of mula. The inn is beautiful but it's not not luxury living by any means. In fact the room I stayed is simply not very nice the room far from perfect but gentle on wallet. They do provide towels for the pool and if you ask for two single beds you will naturally get a bigger room trust me you will be glad you did. The airconditioner worked great, the bar was under construction,the food if you order any is from the sister hotel and way more pricey then the local places just up the road. A few little things the bedding, sheets and comforter felt more like hay then bedding the shower curtain was ripped in places and there was some mold on the curtains. When I booked this vacation we planned on trying to stay on a budget so we could spend more on drinks & food which worked out great. Also we wanted to be in more with the community and not totally in the tourist only area and this location is perfect. Beyond the cosmetic issues which are easy too overlook with some rum in your belly I would reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: NataliedeP
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Juan and I made sure to thoroughly research and read plenty of reviews on all "budget" and boutique hotels in the area. I finally chose the At Wind Chimes Inn and I couldn't have been happier about this decision! The place is in an upscale residential area, one block from the beach, which is a local spot and there are hardly any tourists- I went during a spring break weekend in March too. Within walking distance to great, local restaurants, as well as Condado. But if you want my advice, don't even waste your time on the Condado strip- this is where all the big hotels are and all the tourists. Super crowded and no good restaurants! The hotel was small and quaint with a pretty Caribbean feel. The staff was amazing- super friendly and helpful, especially Calvin! They went out of their way for us constantly; booked our excursion trip and made a bunch of calls when one of the trips we wanted to do was fully booked. They give you fresh towels and beach chairs whenever you want them for the beach. The room was small but it was inconsequential because I didn't go to San Juan to sit in my room- all I needed was a bed, A/C and a shower with clean towels! Overall, not a single unpleasant thing about this hotel- amazing location and if/when I go back to San Juan I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Part of our trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Alfredo V
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to clarify that we are an average family who loves to travel but tries to save some money when possible. Also, I want to clarify that we spent a lot of nights in non-chain type hotels, so we know how to survive without the standard curved shower curtain, or the standard Hilton Brand alarm on your night stand.... but the experience at At Wind Chimes was so terrible that I really need to talk about it. My wife booked 3 nights at At Wind Chimes 1 month in advance, and when she called the hotel to confirm a crib, she was told that we would be upgraded to the Acacia- wonderful! Call before arriving to know where to check in, they warned her. We got to San Juan, called and found out that the upgrade was fake â€“ back at At Wind Chimes we were! We got to At Wind Chimes. Check in was already troubled by this reverse upgrade, or downgrade. Owner denied any upgrade had ever been offered, and he told us that there are 4 different hotels in San Juan owned by the same owner of the At Wind Chimes. Acacia is right down the road, and is one of these co-owned hotels. Trust me, it is not even in the same category as At Wind Chimes. The look of the hotel is overall Caribbean authentic, at least from the outside. Some renovation was going onâ€¦not very convenient considering the Spring Break period. According to the owner the hotel was full. The swimming pool is in a corner next to the reception.. not very good looking. Not very inviting. Since we were traveling with a 9 month old baby, my wife had called ahead to make sure there was a crib for the baby. Our room at the Acacia was supposed to have a balcony (perfect for when baby went to bed). Our room at At Wind Chimes- not so much. No balcony, no space, very tiny room. We were so disappointed. First of all they asked us to provide the credit card to pay the whole amount. We thought it was for any incidentals, but then we were handed a receipt to sign for another payment. But hey- we already paid in full on Expedia! No, according to At Wind Chimes, we didnâ€™t. (We later checked online- yes of course we had, and we had to repeatedly ask for a refund). Our room was the very last one available (that's what they said). Our room was on the 2nd floor of the 2nd building. After 3 ramps of stairs (no elevator, but they have ground level rooms if you have mobility issues), we finally got to our room. The room was 10' x 10'. Air conditioner under the window 2' from the bed (great for my back...), the room smelled like mold, and it did not look very well cleaned. But the greatest surprise was that the restroom did not have a door (!?!?!) and the window of the bathroom was actually looking at the corridor where all the guests where passing by (the window could not be closed, and we realized quickly that you could hear everything going on in the bathroom from the outside...) The crib was first placed in one position, then moved to another to allow us to access the bed. With the baby, luggage, and us, it was like a puzzle... The smell of mold was still there by the way. Off course there was no balcony eitherâ€¦ so after 7:30 PM, our day was practically over. We had a stained pillow (replaced), dirty towels in the bathroom (replaced). At Wind Chimes really feels more like a hostel than a hotel. Just dirty, unkept and old in general. Internet connection was related to the Boat Bar which is part of the hotel. Connectivity was very poor, and worked only the first day. Speaking of the bar, it was closed for renovation. The carpenters were working from dawn to dusk and everything was happening right in front of our only window. You want to relax in peace, enjoy your time away, have a baby that takes naps? Tough. It was also very noisy with the traffic outside. Remember the window in the bathroom facing the corridor? The corridor has a large opening on the street, that was working as a funnel for all the noises that were easily entering our room every time of the day (and night). The smell of mold was still there by the way.. no matter how low you were trying to keep the air conditioning hoping to reduce the humidity.. it did not work at all. The safety of the room was extremely poor. The same key was opening too many doors... and the lock was very weak. We complained with the owner, but off course the answer was always the same: "We are trying to find you a better room, We are fully booked, We are sorry, but no refunds...". The second day I decided to go with our baby to the swimming pool. As I said the one at At Wind Chimes is not very inviting, but the owner told us that if we want we could go to the sister hotel (the Acacia), I decided to go there to see how it looks. The Acacia is a totally different story. No Smell of Mold (off Course!) and very beautiful. The swimming pool (that is actually a very large hot tub) is on the second floor. Once I saw the hot tub I could not believe that both hotels were actually owned by the same person... The Hot Tub is amazing! It is worth the fare for the hotel just by itself... luckily I found that it is not a real hot tub.. it is just a little bit warm.. Perfect temperature for the baby! We had a wonderful time. I had occasion to look into the rooms facing the pool while the doors where open for the cleaning. They have a big LCD, and very nice paintings. The doors are new, and the lamps are new as well. Very good looking, and very nice style. Unfortunately, at the end of the day, I had to go back to the smell of mold, the small room, and the air conditioning hammering my back all night long. A very good thing of the hotel is the location. You are 5 minutes walk from Kasalta Bakery (wonderful for snacks, breakfast, lunches), and many other small restaurants for the night. 10 minutes to the west, and you are in the center of Condado with hundreds of restaurants and bars. The bus stop is 5 minutes from there. Line #53 will take you straight to the old San Juan (amazing place!). The beach is literally 1 minute walk to the north. You can see the palms or the water at the end of the street. Again, let me reiterate- when I read negative reviews on TripAdvisor, I always think: these people expect too much, they are snobs, etc. However, this is unfortunately my true experience as an absolutely normal person. The level of decency is severely lacking at At Wind Chimes. Of course, as long as you do not like the smell of Mold! In that case, the At Wind Chimes is the perfect place for you! We were very happy to leave the At Wind Chimes to continue out trip around the wonderful island of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cozy inn”
Reviews.Author: Vega_12
Reviews.Content: This is an authentic San Juan inn; inexpensive yet comfortable, with clean classic decor. I booked a room with a double bed. Wind Chimes is one block from the beach, and walking distance to the main commercial Condado area. The room was small, but the bed was comfortable. The shower was clean and the water hot. The sister hotel, the Acacia, half a block closer to the beach had a spa and a restaurant also available to us, but I never had a chance to enjoy it. The staff was the most accommodating and helpful I have ever experienced at a small hotel, with recommendations and concern for my well being. My room did not have a view, but it did have wifi and cable TV. If you want to keep expenses to a minimum but have a safe and comfortable stay in San Juan, I heartily recommend Wind Chimes.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly authentic”
Reviews.Author: suebe02
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Juan with my best friend for a week long getaway. We found amazing rates online and were excited to stay in an area with less tourists and more of an authentic feel. This hotel was perfect! Our room was spacious with 2 twin beds and we had 3 windows that we left open to feel the tropical breeze. There also was air conditioning in the room that worked very well and a ceiling fan in the vaulted ceiling over the bed. The beach was only 1 block away. The pool was fairly small with only room for 2 lounge chairs which were usually taken, however, one day we decided to go to the pool and Calvin, at the front desk, was so kind to move a lounge chair to the pool from the area and bring us another fold up chair from inside. Calvin was also very helpful with advice on places to eat. There is a great place he recommended that is beach front and such a great atmostphere. The food was so delicious. We had whole red snapper. Miguel at the front desk was very helpful calling for taxis, advising us on tours, and telling us where to check out the San Juan night life. We had such a pleasant experience and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for the girls!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen F
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Wind Chimes for a week and we LOVED it. By far the most impressive part of the hotel were the employees. We were greeted by Calvin, who not only lugged our heavy luggage up the stairs without a blink, but he also gave us excellent recommendations for authentic Puerto Rican food in the area. At night time, be sure to ask Miguel at the front desk for anything you need! He called safe, reliable cabs for us on multiple occasions, giving the drivers specific instructions since we didnt speak much Spanish. He also told us all of the night life spots to hit! We had a blast because of him, not to mention he gave us a great referral to a sailboat company that was a highlight of our trip. Aside from the employees, they had a charming cat named Popo, tropical plants everywhere, and our room had three huge windows that we could leave open throughout the day. The pool was just the right small for a boutique hotel, and we enjoyed walking the half block to the huge jacuzzi at the sister hotel around the block. The beach was a 3 minute walk away, and never too crowded. Every day the maid came in and cleaned and tidied our room-- even arranged our shoes that had been scattered around the room! Kasalta bakery is a MUST and within walking distance for breakfast and snacks. Overall, Wind Chimes is a wonderful hotel with wonderful employees, and we will DEFINITELY be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Martamom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and what was advertised didn't match what we got. First of all, the room was tiny, the bed uncomfortable, and the bathroom wasn't clean. Our room was tucked away at the very back of the hotel so perhaps there are nicer rooms in the main building. Work was being done on the patio so we were awakened early by noise. The rates that were advertised in the room were lower than what we paid through an online site. Overall, terrible value for what we got. The hotel was in a nice location - close to a private beach and a short taxi ride to Old San Juan. Staff was very pleasant and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cute, and oh so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: southerngalNc
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected extra night stay in San Juan. We had walked by At Wind Chimes on our way back from the beach one day and saw how lovely and tucked away this boutique hotel was. It is hidden behind lovely foliage and white stucco walls with an arched wooden door covered in flowers. We stopped to comment on how lovely the property was. When we got stuck for one extra day, we thought we would just try for a spot (with fingers' crossed!). Luck! There was one room available at a comparable price of the hotels in the area. Every thing about this place is cute and they are so friendly at the desk. We got to our room and immediately walked across the street to their sister hotel, Acia, where we spent half the night in their rooftop jacuzzi! This thing is the size of a pool and makes you feel like you are in paradise in the middle of downtown San Juan! Just make sure to press the button for bubbles, or you are just in a giant bath tub! These people are wonderful and friendly, and not trying to take advantage of tourists like so much of the rest of San Juan! HIghly recommend this little jewel.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: cromocat
Reviews.Content: San Juan is a vacation destination, everyone knows that. I was born and raised in Puerto Rico and "go home" often. Circumstances have changed and so I don't have a family member to stay with, forcing me to look at hotels. Well, when I go home I want to spend my time and money on quality things. The fluff and puff don't attract me, so obviously I want to stay away from the "tourist traps". The following are my recommendations/observations. The Wind Chimes hotel is right in the middle of the best part of the Condado, a small section of San Juan area, for night life, beach, restaurants and shopping. Let's face it, even the locals hang out in San Juan/Condado. Just a few short blocks West of the Wind Chimes are some great restaurants and the new "rodeo drive" with big ticket shops. The beach is just a short walk across the street (half a city block). Which is awesome to be able to walk to and not have to worry about parking (which is very difficult in Condado). Kasalta bakery is a few blocks East on the same street- breakfast is a must there. As far as value- i loved not having to pay $300/night for a non-personal, crowded hotel experience. Instead I paid $150/night for a King size bed with friendly service. The room wasn't a modern clean-cut pristine model of perfection, but i was comfortable and the room/sheets/towels were clean. Besides, when I come to PR, the last place i want to hang out is the room!! Be sure to meet Popo the cat... he's friendly and a great example of "relax".

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: dchampoldfields
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the wind chimes inn unknown it would be down the block from the main inn. i was very glad it was. they have the biggest hot tub i have ever seen, you could call it a swimming pool. i love the warm water, it even had a water fall. the staff was wonderful. it is walking distance to the beach. you could say this beach has 3 phases. 1 for the normal morning and noon people and then between 5-8 pm the local bring their bogs to the beach. i really enjoyed watching them. i still wish i was one of them. then my boyfriend told me not to go after dark due to robbers, i did anyway, all by my self and had no problems, the ocean is so warm. you must,and i say must, ask for a two beds in the room. the single bedroom is too small of a room. you can always move the beds together. it is worth every penny just to have the big outdoors hot tub. the parking is a problem only if you are not good at parking, but by boyfriend squeezed our rental in every night without a problem. remember the hot tub must be at least 4 feet deep. i give the cleanliness poor since the floor had sand on them. it was not carpet. but the hot tub mad up for the door floors.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dmervis
Reviews.Content: We stayed At Wind Chimes for my cousins wedding. Not visiting Puerto Rico prior to her wedding, we weren't exactly sure of the area. This hotel is perfect if you are looking for true Puerto Rican charm and looking to have that privacy. The whole hotel is gated and once you check in, you will recieve a key (Not a key card but an actual key) to both the Wind Chimes as well as there sister property right down the street. The hotel does not have a place to eat on site however; is within walking distance of places such as Kasaltas (Which was awesome) and Bebos--If you are looking for the authentic Puerto Rican feel, this place is perfect! The rooms are a bit small and the bathroom does not offer the most privacy as it is shutter-doors but the rate is perfect ($89.00+) . I highly recommend this hotel--it was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Extended Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ADHfam
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Wind Chimes Hotel (or just Wind Chimes) is a cozy villa tucked into a beach neighborhood, surrounded by what appear to be high rise condos and/or hotels. Since we arrived during the end of the off-season, there were less touristas around than typical. The ride from the airport was only about 10 minutes, and one of the first things we noticed was the crazy drivers everywhere! This is relevant because it makes the cab fair ($15-20) to and from the airport and Old San Juan seem reasonable when you realize how much work is actually involved protecting the precious cargo. It is also relevant since there is a likelihood you will wake up to car horns if you sleep in and leave your window open. The hotel is by no means on a busy thoroughfare though, and seems more like a quiet garden plucked down in between the tall buildings surrounding it. Hotel staff was very friendly, and upgraded us to the honey moon suite since it had not been reserved (we had requested a king size bed, not sure how available that request may have been otherwise), so we had our own private balcony overlooking the inner courtyard! The plaster walls, terra cotta shingles and tiling are warm and inviting, surrounded by the plant life and pottery decorating the interior walls of the resort. The pool is small but inviting, and unfortunately the in house bar was closed for the off season. Our room was not the largest for a suite, but more than adequate for our purposes, with nice amenities and furniture. We also spent a fair amount of time at the sister hotel Acacia about a half block away towards the beach, which boasts a fine restaurant, along with the largest hot tub in San Juan (or is it all of Puerto Rico?). The staff there was also very welcoming and accommodating. While we unfortunately did not have occasion to enjoy dinner there, we had two excellent breakfasts and the menu is diverse. Wind Chimes is perfect for anyone who wishes to stay near the beach, and who does not require the perhaps more extensive (& expensive!) amenities of a larger hotel (hence the boutique tag). Besides being close, the beach appeared clean and well kept, although the water was a bit rough this time of year. We were happy just to get away from December in a gloomy northeast city, and while we were there, it was the perfect spot! We would have probably given the hotel and "excellent" rating if we were there longer or during the peak season (didn't get the full experience with the in-house bar, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quaint but lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: windcall
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel, close to the beach. The rooms and bathrooms are very small but nicely decorated and clean. The front desk is not always manned - you have to go down the street to the "sister hotel" for anything after hours. Also when I was there the bar was closed, and no food was being served at the hotel - again they refer you down the street to the sister hotel. The sister hotel was much nicer big jug of spa water on the front desk, and tasty upscale restaurant. I definitely felt like I was staying with the B-team...but it was reasonably priced, the staff was very nice - also had computer problems checking out, but...close to airport and very open beach. I would recommend - but shop around you can get rooms for $65/nt

Reviews.Title: “Charming delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caraboo11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a free 4 night stay at this hotel, so we stayed here for our 10 year anniversary. It was so charming! The rooms were quaint and cozy. I loved the bar that is available to the guests. The front staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was just a few blocks from a beautiful beach! My husband felt the room was a bit to small but for as little time as we spent there I thought it was perfect. The wifi didn't work in our room but it worked great in the lobby and out by the pool. I gave it a 4 on cleanliness because of the dust bunnies on the top of pictures, lamps, and furniture that my husband noticed (I'm apparently not that observant). The sheets, toilets, and showers were very clean. The flowers in the courtyard was beautiful! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: AJEinnkeeper
Reviews.Content: MY partner and I needed a little get away and we chose this place based on a friend's recommendation. We are used to staying in Bed & Breakfast type accommodations and this was more hotel-like so it didnt meet our expectations regarding personalized service. Most of the desk staff was nonchalant and not especially friendly. The rooms were classic Caribbean with spartan furnishings and not up to US mainland standards for cleanliness...especially B & B standards of cleanliness. Loved being at the pool. It was a nice haven after being out in the hot PR weather all day. The "sister" hotel which was a block away had a huge hot tub available to Wind Chime guests. It was fun. There is supposedly a happy hour at the bar. We check several times while we were there at the designated time and no one was manning the bar. Not a critical thing.. but they shouldn't promote it. While some people would find this an okay place and we would consider it again, I believe we would likely try another accommodation before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Robadabadoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Wife for 4 nights. Hotel was recommended by my Aunt, who had stayed here before. A cab ride from the SJU airport was $18.50 (plus tip). The taxi stand gives you a quote up front based on that "Zone" you are going to and how much luggage you have, so there are no surprises when you get there. (We also took a cab to Old San Juan one day which was about $15 each way). We were greeted at the front door and there were no problems at check-in. The front desk clerk even carried our bags up to our room. The room was on the 2nd floor of the main building. It had a private entry to a large balcony which led to our room. The room itself was ok, the word "charming" comes to mind. A queen bed, small table & chairs, large dresser, nice 19" LCD tv with cable, air conditioning (and a ceiling fan). The bathroom has a shower only. (and a hair-dryer which died while we were there). My only complaint was there were little ants that found their way in and for some reason liked the small table top. Housekeeping was always quick to replace towels and make up the bed (I don't think they actually cleaned, other than taking the trash out). The hotel is 2 blocks from a fairly secluded beach, which was nice. Not alot of people. Occasionally a man selling beer and water for $1 passes you on the beach. The water was a little murky and rough due to some thunderstorms. The pool is small but very nice. The pool area itself is tiny and can only accommodate 2 lounge chairs. There is a deck area overlooking the pool that has another 2 lounge chairs. There is a bar (themed after a ship) hidden all the way in the back of the hotel. It was closed the first night but open the next. Reasonably priced drinks for a hotel bar and the bartender was super nice. We were told the hotel had about 27 rooms. The overall facility seemed to small to accommodate a full house. Overall we enjoyed it, but after the 3rd night we were ready to leave. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Serene and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: rosepr
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was close to San Jorge Childrenâ€™s Hospital where a family member is being treated. When booking on-line, I didnâ€™t realize that we were supposed to ask for parking in addition to the room reservation. So make sure that you write in the comments if you need parking or you will be forced to find parking on the street (which is hard to find). But once we got past the parking issue, everything was wonderful. The woman at the front desk was super nice and helpful. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The bathroom was big enough. The shower stall was nice. Of course, as with almost every hotel in Puerto Rico, the water pressure was lacking. The young lady bartending at the Boat Bar was very friendly. She made us some interesting tropical drinks which we enjoyed very much. We had a pizza ordered from the hotels sister hotel/restaurant, to the boat Bar and it was very tasty also. The pool was well maintained and very pretty. The common areas are very cute too! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Quaint, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cornmaster123
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Staff was helpful and knowledgable. Short walk to big hotel strip. Beautiful pool and bar!!!! Would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Cancellation Policy”
Reviews.Author: ladyctc
Reviews.Content: I reserved a 5-night stay for two rooms for my spouse and another couple, then another short stay for the two rooms a few days later, planning to return to San Juan after driving the island. In all, I had four confirmation numbers. When we arrived, my husband and I determined could not stay there as we knew our friends due to arrive the next day would be extrememly disappointed. As a travel professional, I know that brochures and websites can be extrememly mis-leading and I found this to be the case. The photo of two beach chairs and a wide angle photo of the building showing it all by itself did not represent that the hotel was surrounded by rundown highrises. Tiny pool and a dim room without even a window. There were certainly no beach chairs, only thin towels that were loaned out at the desk. I believe At Wind Chimes has many positive qualities and many repeat customers. Rooms are inexpensive and the staff did seem nice. The building is attractive and reasonably well furnished. It is on a residential corner surrounded by a high wall. The "limited four star" rating is a bit of a stretch. I did not think that the advertising lived up to the reality, so this makes it difficult to rate. Reservations must be paid in full in advance, and the cancellation policy goes into effect 10 days prior to arrival. And they charge for three nights. So with four prepaid reservation numbers, I was asked to pay for 10 hotel nights when we left after the first day. We actually only stayed in one room for one night, then checked out and cancelled the rest of our stay and our friends' stay. They begrudgingly waived the four nights at the end, but it still cost me well over a thousand dollars.

Reviews.Title: “They do their best, but it's simply not enough”
Reviews.Author: jakebarrett78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned today from a four night stay at At Wind Chimes Inn, and it was extremely disappointing. As I shared in the ratings, the staff and service is very nice and very helpful, there were issues beyond their control that will ensure that I never stay there again. THE ROOM: Firstly, the room (room 120) was in a location that made it very loud and difficult to sleep. ALl night long there were cars and trucks heard on the street below. Besides this there were also sounds coming from within the building itself, such as a whining fridge motor, or a squeaky ceiling fan. These sounds combine to make it very difficult to get a good night's rest. the room was also not cleaned very well. When you closed the bathroom door and looked at it from inside the bathroom it was covered with dust. This leads me to believe that they cleaning crew has not done a very thorough job. The tile floor was also very dirty, and walking around barefoot left me with a collection of grit and sand on my feet that I had not brought into the room. To top this all off, on the last night we were there I discovered a COCKROACH in my clothes! My wife found another one a few minutes later that scurried across the floor. Granted, upon bringing this to the attention of the people at the front desk we were immediately given a new room for the night, but it was still a big negative for us. LOCATION: While I did feel safe within the hotel and with the location of the hotel itself, I felt like we were right on the edge of a safe area, venturing into a bad one. If we walked one block further from the beach or one block to the east, the neighborhood became very run down, barren, and dark. Heading to the west was great as it sent us towards the more trendy and friendly area of Avenido Ashford.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Riva312
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was helpful with directions and advice. They assisted me with securing reservations for adventures, tours and accommodations. The hotel is a short one block walk to clean beaches where you can elect to rent a chair or just relax on your towel. Restaurants nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner or take the bus (for .75) to Old San Juan and explore the town. Bartender Jaime Vargas made the most incredible mojito's and poured a mean beer! The rooms are tiny but clean. The pool was tended to each day and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place once you turn the lights out...”
Reviews.Author: Squeakysneakers
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked our first vacation to Ocean Park and spent 3-5 hours researching exactly where we wanted to stay. We picked Acacia Hotel. When we arrived we were told we were told at Acacia we needed to check in at Chime Winds their sister hotel and that we would be staying there. WHAT a disappointment. Dirty rooms, no iron, no fridge, and a room service that didn't seem to clean anything, just made sure our AC was turned off. This place Is a complete dump. HOWEVER, we only stayed here two days and were able to move over to Acacia. Chad and ACACIA were top notch. A great place to stay, huge jacuzzi, a balcony that has a view of the ocean, a great chef on board and just a great vibe.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Maitra
Reviews.Content: At the Winds Chimes is a great hotel, in a beautiful neighborhood and with really great staff. This is one of my favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILY ORIENTATED. Helped with exactly what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: KarenSequim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our daughters & 1 other couple. We wanted our girls right next door not 1/2 a hotel away.- our booking wasn't that way, but they gladly changed our room locations, so it would work. They treated us like we wanted to be treated. Love Po Po the kitty. If you want stuffy or ordinary - don't stay here. A very quaint, family Inn. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: IxChel3300
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room here based on reviews and did so over eight months in advance. We reserved a room with two queens & a kitchenette. When we arrived, we were charged that rate, but told that the hotel no longer has kitchenette rooms. We were charged the lesser amount. The two main complaints were the cleanliness (it seems to be a Puerto Rican tradition not to clean floors as every place we stayed seemed to be the same!) and the curtains for the front window were not big enough to close. It wouldn't be such a problem except that it was the window that faced the main street. When we complained, we were told that someone would look at it - they never did. On the plus side, it is a decent hotel with a good location, pleasant staff, and is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “One Night in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: chetshell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise. Luggage storage before check-in was a problem. They do not have a room or secure area to leave your luggage. The lobby & stair area was littered w/ luggage. We left ours & headed over to the beach; which is only 1 block away. We had no problems but is was a little unnerving to leave all our valuables. Our room was clean & well air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty and quaint hotel that needs better housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Hikinfuul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way to a cruise. The hotel is charming, and the neighborhood in which it is located seemed safe and clean, and convenient to the beach. Those preferring to tour old SJ may want to stay closer. The road it is on is quiet by day, but is busy and loud at night. Our windows did not close all the way, which did not really concern me, b/c they did have bars on them. We got a VERY small room next to the lobby, which made sleeping challenging (for me-my husband sawed logs all night.). Folks we were traveling with got an enormous room upstairs, so they are not all so small. The staff was friendly and helpful enough, but the surfaces of the rooms and bathrooms were not very clean. It looks like housekeeping does the bare minimum. Probably would not go back, but their cat is adorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaDee72
Reviews.Content: Following recommendations at Travel Advisor, we booked two nights each at Wind Chimes before and after our cruise that departed from San Juan. In the end we actually stayed in the sister hotel Acacia just down the road, which is only 50 m from Condado beach. Both hotels are very nicely furnished (stylish lobby, simple but nice rooms with flat screen TVs, jacuzzi), and Acacia has a quite good restaurant (can be used for breakfast as well). The staff is friendly and helpful, and all is clean. We got an excellent deal for our money! So if you look for a small hotel with personal, friendly atmosphere instead of staying at a big resort hotel (and don't mind carrying your baggage a bit, there is no elevator), then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrified! I gave up all the money for nothing.”
Reviews.Author: qtito21
Reviews.Content: When I got to the hotel there were no parking for my car, there are only two parking spot in the hotel. When the issued the room key and I went to the room there was a big cat that enter the room and got under the bed chasing for something; I couldnâ€™t get him out of the room. The room was humid and I told the manager about it. She said â€œwe wait for the costumer to turn the AC on to save electricity. I asked the manager about the cat and her answer wasâ€� the cat belongs to the Hotelâ€�. I didnâ€™t like the cat in the room, the smell of the room, no parking for my vehicle so I decided to cancel the reservation. But they policy is to cancel 10 days prior to check in or you will pay all the days you booked online. I end going to another hotel and paying more but with parking, no cat in my room and pleasant with no smell. After all my complaints, they charged my credit card for all the days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: shander70
Reviews.Content: At Wind Chimes is a nice, quiet, peaceful hotel. It only has about 20 rooms so you get personalized service. It is situated in a neighborhood away from the hotels and casinos so if you're looking for glitz and glamor go elsewhere. This hotel has a small backyard size pool with a waterfall, which we enjoyed all weekend to ourselves. Our room had it's own private balcony overlooking the courtyard and pool. The bed was comfortable and the room size was typical. There was beautiful landscaping everywhere. We were a small block/ 2 minute walk to one of the best beaches in San Juan. We went on two excursions and we were picked up right at the front door. We experienced wonderful service and expert advice from the staff. The only con I have is that there were not many places to eat near the hotel. We did not rent a car so when we were back at the hotel we had to walk. The hotel restaurant which we heard was exceptional was in the sister hotel, Acacia next door and never seemed to be open, plus it's prices were 5 Star, so not a place to go for every meal on my budget. Bebos Cafe was a two block walk which I would describe it as kind of like a Dennys. Kasalta, which is a famous bakery that is in all the travel books, was a six block walk. It was worth the walk but not something I wanted to do everyday. Our room did have a mini fridge which was handy. All in all you have to go to this hotel with the right expectations. It's not the Marriott but it's clean, well priced and you are treated like family. It felt like a bed and breakfast (without the breakfast). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a sweet place!”
Reviews.Author: girl1982
Reviews.Content: this place is beautiful,peacefull and loverly people! but if you want to be closest to the city try another one. Perfect for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: KBoler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent four nights at the Acacia Seaside Inn/Wind Chimes Inn. We originally booked with Wind Chimes, but upon our arrival we were offered an upgrade to a room with a terrace at the Acacia. The sister hotels are a block apart, and our key gave us access to the amenities of both places. The Acacia was such a charming and cozy place. It is beautifully decorated and well cared for. Our room, while a bit on the small side, had everything we needed, and the jacuzzi was literally steps from our door. The walk to the beach was very quick- about half a block, as was the walk over to Wind Chimes, where we were able to enjoy the pool and the little bar that was tucked away behind the building. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable and full of character, and the hotel itself was peaceful and restorative. There were also several great restaurants and bars within easy walking distance.Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mellow Rico”
Reviews.Author: Gua1terio
Reviews.Content: After a slight mix-up that had me sleeping in the lobby for a few hours, the VERY gracious and generous staff quickly checked me in. I was in the back room where I virtually had the patio to myself. It is a little dark there, but that didn't bother me. I LOVED this place! The beach is just down the street, not far from their sister hotel. The parking can be a little dicey if you don't pay, but I always found a spot on the side of the hotel. I recommend you rent a car, if you want to get around on the island better. I would stay here again or try their sister hotel, ACACIA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for a No-Frills stay”
Reviews.Author: KikiLis34
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for an inexpensive yet unique boutique inn for our 10 day stay in Puerto Rico. We rented a car and spent most of our time sightseeing around the island, but I would not recommend this inn if you are planning on spending a lot of time at the hotel or not leaving the San Juan area. The accommodations were basic but neat. However, our room was right off of the front desk on the first floor, and we would get awakened by noisy guests almost every night. The type of people that stayed here tended to lack class. Moreover, when finally one night we were awakened at 3 am by a loud group waiting for the their flight to leave, and asked the man at the front desk to ask them to keep it down, he refused and it resulted in a very unpleasant disagreement with him. We were finally able to get our room switched to a nicer one, away from the front desk area after that, but after spending the majority of the trip having our sleep disturbed, it was a small consolation. Overall, I would recommend this place if you are on a very tight budget with your travel and you make sure you don't get a first floor room, but I would never go back there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: revgag
Reviews.Content: It felt very quaint staying in this hotel, and it is situated in a very nice neighborhood, and a laid back feeling. It is close to several nice restaurants, and a 10 min walk to the bustling El condado area shopping/eating area. Its a block away form the El condado beach and only a few min walk to the Ocean Park beach. It is recommended to have a car to go around because the cab rides cost $15 each time. The hotel does not serve breakfast which is a shame. They have a hidden bar, but isn't that attractive. But the El Condado area has a lot to offer. It is a $15 ride from the airport. We loved the small outdoor pool and the fountain. It was relaxing to dip yourself inside in a very humid weather. The hotel is decent, and if your dont want to drive, all the day trip companies will pick you and drop you back. we had nice day trip to Old San juan in a local bus (for which you have to wait LONG (15-40min), which costed 75 cents only. But we drove to Isle Verde beach, Luquillo beach and El Junque the rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for a family reunion”
Reviews.Author: CalWanderers
Reviews.Content: Twenty-two people from our extended family came to San Juan for a reunion. Air-conditioned rooms were comfortable. The staff was very accommodating and gave us good suggestions about where to eat. The upstairs shaded veranda was the perfect place for our group to gather.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel - Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: DAB61
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one week at the Wind Chimes Inn and had a wonderful time. It's a Bed & Breakfast type boutique hotel in a beautiful Spanish style villa in a nice residential area. The beach - public, clean and mostly empty when I was there - is literally 2 minutes (walking ) away, just 1/2 a block down the road. What makes the Wind Chimes Inn such a great place to stay is its staff (very attentive), the location (you can walk to most restaurants in the area as well as to the beach) and for me, that I felt safe and well taken care of as a solo traveler. I had planned to travel with a friend, but she canceled last minute and I was a bit worried going solo, but felt right at home . If you want to meet fellow guests, you can do so at the pool (small, but nice to cool off), sun terrace or the cute bar where they offer coffee (no food) in the morning and a no cash bar at night. Breakfast and dinner are served at their sister hotel, the Acacia, which is about 50 yards down the road towards the beach. The Acacia has 1 star mor eand reminds me a bit of a tiny W style hotel. The restaurant at the Acacia, the Niche, is top notch. Chef Oscar is combining international food with a local flavor. I went there 3 times for dinner and a wonderful Sunday brunch and each time the food was excellent and the pricing was fair considering quality and quantity. The service was excellent. I also tested a few of the other "higher end" restaurants recommended by TripAdvisor and none of them was better than Niche and most of them more expensive. I travel a lot on business organizing events and off sides for a living and stayed at 5 star hotels, some of the named "Best of.." by Conde Nast Traveler over the years. This was a private trip, not paid by my clients and I was on a budget. The Wind Chimes Inn is a 3 star hotel and doesn't pretend to be more than that, but you get a lot for your money. I'll be back! One word of advise: If you are sensitive to noise, make sure not to get a room next to the reception. I would also suggest not too close to the bar.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to go home”
Reviews.Author: hotelluver1236
Reviews.Content: We loved it!Very freindly and helpful.We loved being a block a away from a great beach.Easy walking to many places nice people in the city.Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice(ish) little Inn with big potential”
Reviews.Author: Neri212
Reviews.Content: You can tell this Inn was at one time a lot nicer. I knew this would be a no-frills stay when I booked it for just a night- which is FINE, we love Inns and B&B's so we expect certain short comings.The outside areas are really pretty with a traditional spanish colonial feel. The woman who checked us in was very nice and interesting. Everything was clean, although the room just felt dirty because it needed updating. The bolt lock on the door was missing, the door was all scratched and beat up. The tiles in the shower were old and discolored. I honestly think there are better values out there. I have stayed at many places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Incrediable Stay"”
Reviews.Author: thepartyguys
Reviews.Content: Wow, we just returned from a 5 night stay at the Acacia Inn which is a sister property of At Wind Chimes located about a half a block nearer the ocean-actually practically on the ocean! Both properties were exquisite. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the staff was very professional yet fun. There is a private bar for hotel guests located At Wind Chimes that opens at 5 and being that it is only for hotel guests you really get to know the bartenders and others staying there which is really nice. The small but refreshing pool is also located at this property of approx. 20 rooms or so. At the Acacia, where we stayed, was the largest whirlpool I've ever seen. Literally one could do laps in it. It had a ncie view of the ocean as it sits on the second story roof top. Also at this location is a nice roof top viewing area that lends a spectacular view and breeze during the early evening hours. To top it off there is a restaurant on site called Niche which we ate at our last night and it was absolutely wonderful. I had the salt encrusted fliet mingnon and my buddy had octoupus stuffed with fresh shrimp. Incredible meal. The price is most certainly a bargain for what you get-the only thing I would suggest is that they upgrade their shampoo and soap from Breck and Dial to something more fitting for their environment., other than that, spectacular place!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, I guess”
Reviews.Author: cagU2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the good reviews and the fact that it was considered a good value. I guess I was expecting a little more for $150 a night. On the plus side, the staff was very friendly and the outdoor areas are cute, the place seemed pretty clean. Location was good - easy access to the highway, the beach, the airport, and Old San Juan. In addition, we found street parking fairly easily for our rental car. We were put in room 102, which was right off the lobby - ended up being really loud several times during the middle of the night. The room was TINY as well... there was barely a foot in between the bed and the walls/furniture. Barely enough room to set down our suitcases. Bathroom was tiny too. All in all, it was just ok. I guess I was just expecting a little more based on the glowing reviews we had read prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated hotel. No perks”
Reviews.Author: latina3383
Reviews.Content: To describe our trip. We got to the hotel and all the doors were locked--now late with no signs of life around the hotel. Started to panic a bit, especially when no one was answering the front desk. Reservation had already been made, and they knew around what time we would be getting there. After hitting the doors, the bar attendant finally opened up. Inside the hotel had lush flora and spanish type decor. The room is basic. Advertised in Que Pasa as having OceanFront view. This hotel does not. It's "sister hotel does". Breakfast was included in the price, but it's at it's "sister hotel". The staff upon reservation should have told us we had to wake up earlier if we wanted breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: cjoRuralMaine
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Wind Chimes. The staff was fantastic. Thank you Lynette, Jenny( Sweetie, I also think you said your name was Bridgette and Jenny/Ginny was your nick name) and of course, dear sweet Desiree!!!! Desiree has only been there a few short weeks, but she is a real sweetheart.. We locked ourselves out of our room and she was so cute, friendly and hooked us up and let us in. Cocoa is the resident cat. Adorable. Very private and peaceful accomodations.. We skipped the boat bar, but those who were there, seemed to be having tons of fun. Yes, the place could use a bit of sprucing up, a little paint and nominal updates, but it has old world CHARM. We stayed in room111, with a couch and really nice king size bed The room was large!!!. The refrigerator/sink and 2 burner combo was old but adequate. I would have added a microwave for convenience sake. 2 ceilling fans, great a/c. I bought a can of lemon air freshener as I felt the air was a bit stuffy. That fixed the problem. The windows in that room do not open, but I think that some on the upper floor do.. Breakfast was served at their sister hotel. The waves were fierce but the beach was just 2 blocks away. \I waded in the surf and my hubby is part fish so he had no probs swimming.. Loved the shared patio with lounge chairs and shade, overlooking the pool.. Small pool but we felt like we had the entire place to ourselves.Mini library on the second floor was a godsend, since I finished the 2 books I brought with me. ( I added mine to their collection.) The bus was fun to old San Juan..75 cents. Exact change only. The greenery and flowers on the property were lovely. Also, the full moon from the top patio...amazing! That area has 2 couches and an overhang, if you are outside and it's too sunny, plus 2 tables with chairs under the twinkling stars or endless blue skies... Multiple windchimes singing and birds birds birds chirping in that area. Remember...this is a BUDGET HOTEL (. Fodor's recommends it.) Walgreens and a 24 hour grocery store are just a few blocks away, plus endless restaurants and convenience stores....nice museum within walking distance. Dont miss El Morro and the other fort was even more interesting. Hope to return next year. Gracious!

Reviews.Title: “small oasis in the big city”
Reviews.Author: DidiJ
Reviews.Content: At Wind Chimes Inn is a nice place in San Juan to stay in. Reasonably priced, good location (two buslines on O'Leary St, and, as the busses run irregularly, 15 minutes to walk to the heart of Condado or just 2 blocks to the beach). Quiet atmosphere, nice (small!) pool, nice bar. The rooms are ok, a bit smallish, but clean and comfortable. TV in my room had a mediocre picture quality, ac is not of the quietest kind. But, hey, it's not a 5 star hotel, so all of that was perfectly ok. Staff at hte reception was helpful and courteous, and I was happy to discover a small library on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluebird33
Reviews.Content: Wind Chimes was the most terrible hotel I've ever stayed in. The ventilation in the room was poor and I had a hard time sleeping at night. The windows did not have insect screens. Sleeping was a nightmare because of the noise outside - it seemed like the walls were made out of cardboard. Location is just OK. Close to the beach, indeed, but the beach was not great to say the least. The closest nice beach is 15-20 min away ($15.00 one way by taxi) The hotel offered a breakfast for about $10.00, but it only consisted of bagels, pastries, juice and coffee. Staff is not helpful, I always had to watch the bills. Could not wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small Inn”
Reviews.Author: MercyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: From Rincon to Condado. We wanted to visit Old San Juan but we did not want a hotel in Old San Juan, so we stayed At Windchimes Inn which is like 15 minutes away. It's a cute & cozy little place. Perfect to return to after your visit to Old San Juan and relax and enjoy a drink at the Boat bar behind the garden (which we didn't even know it was there). If you don't want to go out to a restaurant they do have Tapas (but not a big selection). The people who work there were all nice and friendly. We wanted a good restaurant and they referred us to Pamela's at Numero Uno Guest House. Now, after tasting their food, they have the best Caribbean Cuisine! It was delicious. Pricy but worth it! Even the dessert was delicious and Numero Uno Guest House is right on the beach, so that will be our next stop next time we visit San Juan b/c it looked so nice and it was the best food we had in the 7 days that we were in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robtemoore
Reviews.Content: Well priced Boutique Hotel. Unlike the chain hotels, staff very friendly and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back to the Wind Chimes Inn.”
Reviews.Author: reycruz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great one week stay at the Winds chimes inn. People should do a little bit of research before going and booking a trip, if you want a 5 star hotel then book a 5 star hotel. I wasn't expecting the Ritz and that's why my wife and I enjoyed our stay. The place is very unique and charming. Great pool, great bar with William as a bartender, the rooms were a little small but cozy. Housekeeping was good also. The customer service there was phenomenal. We were treated so nice from check in to check out. It's in a great location, one block away from a great beach. Minutes from Old San Juan and the airport. For breakfast we would travel east on Mcleary to Kasaalta cafe and bakery. The breakfast and coffee were awesome, and the pastries were marvelous. Make sure you do a day trip to Culebra Island. The most beautiful beach I've seen so far it's Flamenco beach there. White sand, crystal clear blue water and incredible snorkeling. Thank you Winds Chimes Inn for a great vacation, we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “FIND A BETTER PLACE”
Reviews.Author: FOXBAT7687
Reviews.Content: Big mistake... The place was dingy... Not one soul there.. Pool dirty and tiny.. the "Tiki" Bar was no Tiki Bar.. not one human being there. Did not look anything as advertised. Dirt all over. We had to carry our own luggage 2 flights us. We even saw a prostitute not too far from the hotel. We asked to leave right away and refund our money. The front desk girl, I believe her name was Lynette, got an attitude once we told her we wanted to leave and told us we would be charged for two nights as cancelation fees. We were out the next day. And to top it all off,, they charged me for my son being with us, as they claimed I did not add him in the package..oh..and lets not forget the tiny parking space they have which they charge you daily for. HORRIBLE..HORRIBLE...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good experience”
Reviews.Author: Prietto0
Reviews.Content: This is a "get what you pay for" situation. It's not fancy, but it's more than adequate. My husband and I had a great time staying there. We didn't go to San Juan to hang out in the hotel, so it met all of our needs. The staff were very friendly and helpful, helping us making rental car/travel reservations, etc. The bar was available for a couple drinks before heading out in the evening. Our main complaint was with the location of our room, it was right next to the front desk and we could hear everything. Luckily (and unluckily) the air conditioning unit was very loud so it drowned out some of the commotion. But, like I said, we were only there to sleep so this didn't bother us too much. This doesn't reflect on the hotel at all, but we wished we had stayed in Old San Juan. Condado was nice, with great restaurants and it was still close to OSJ, but it wasn't as much of the vacation experience we were looking for. I would definitely consider staying there again, but I would be sure to ask for an upstairs room.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother staying here!”
Reviews.Author: bcaaron
Reviews.Content: Don't bother staying here! We review this hotel on line and decided to stay her based on the photos of the inn. We chose this hotel for our 3 night weekend getaway for our anniversary. The front desk staff was unfriendly and very rude. The biggest disappointment was that the hotel bar, which was only open till 7 pm on a Fri. night and did not even open on Sat or Sun. The pool is tiny with No lounge chairs poolside and if u want sun you have to go to another area. There is No Parking for guests(3 spots in a tiny courtyard you have to pay extra for). The beach is a 2 block walk . The rooms are only average for the price of a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Above average small inn”
Reviews.Author: Lynntt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wind Chimes last week with my sister. Had a very large room, the 2 queen on the ground floor. Small bathroom, but nicely done. Sleeping area large and comfortable, at least until the a/c went out - then they moved us to Acacia, and I'll also write a review there. The thing that totally disappointed me was the "kitchenette". It consisted of a single unit with 1/2 size frig, small sink, 2 burners. Lots of supplies but no coffeemaker or microwave, so I only used it to keep water cold...until the door fell off. To be fair they did fix the door. It was clean and cool when the a/c was working, and the beds were very comfortable. They were very nice about moving us to Acacia at about 10PM our third night in town, which was a definite upgrade. Overall, though, I can't give Wind Chimes the highest rating. But if you can get a good rate it's definitely do-able for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and moderate, well worth your stay.”
Reviews.Author: uVIEW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Windchimes Inn, San Juan PR twice in June 2009. The place is modern, private, clean and rooms are somewhat small. I would not recommend it to families with children, since there is not enough space for the children to run a bit, as they usually do. However, I would definately stay there again. They also offer parking for $10.00 a night. Breakfast for about $10 dollars. I think they offered a continental breakfast w/ eggs. Check w/ Inn on this. Clean beds and rooms. You can catch bus # 52 up the street to historic San Juan for 0.75 cents one way each person and be there in 15 minutes. It was pretty nice to be able to do this. Lynette, the front desk person, is such a very helpful and friendly person. She helped so much in getting me around, whether it was recommendations for food, or beach (right up one block), directions or arranging for the rental car company pick up at the Inn. May favorite place for dining, especially for breakfast/lunch is called La Pattiserie, a french cafe about six blocks north on Ashland Avenue; a main avenue. Windchimes Inn is a really good value, especially since it is a centrally located place, good clean rooms, service, and the airport is only about four miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ricangreengo
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for me. We didn't want to stay in a typical tourist resort in Isla Verde. The location was perfect. Two blocks from the beach nestled amongst villas and high rises and within walking distance to restaurants in Condado. It was tremendous. The staff were very helpful, the bartender was a riot, the room was small but clean and met all are needs. I can't wait to go back- we've already started saving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dorothy0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the cost was inexpensive for Saun Jaun. And it was a value. It is one block from the beach, two blocks from a great playground for children and a bus stop, and within walking distance to the grocery store and many restaurants. Our room was very large, clean, and over looked the pool and street. The staff was very helpful with advice on local restaurants. While the hotel is not plush, there was not one bad thing about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a get away!”
Reviews.Author: travelMOMMa63
Reviews.Content: Cute little place close to beach and within walking distance to restaurants and bars. Took city bus to Old San Juan for tours of forts.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jbugknoxville
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and a friend and I stayed here for 8 nights the first week of November. We had two queen beds in a large, corner room upstairs from the front desk. The front desk staff as well as Manny at the Boat Bar were very helpful and friendly the entire stay. We had no problems with our room and we enjoyed the proximity to the beach and the bus stop. We used the bus for trips into Old San Juan and also Isla Verde while utlizing recommendations for other day trips around the island from the staff. Our two favorite local places to eat were Kasalta's for breakfast/lunch and then Bebo's for dinner. On several occasions when it was raining we ate at the inn and enjoyed the company at the bar as well as the food. I agree with other reivews that some of the rooms looked very small and I would not have wanted a room near the bar but we plan on returning this year and asking for our same room again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: midge165
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were on our first trip to Puerto Rico for a wedding. At Wind Chimes Inn and it's sister hotel Acacia Seaside Inn were recommended places for us to stay by the wedding party. I booked our 3 night reservation a few months in advance, was quoted a price for a king size room but when we checked in they charged us a higher rate for a queen size room. Even though I had the confirmation number written down, they claimed we needed the email confirmation...something we never received. So after we got our key we headed up to our room...#127. We passed through the lobby, pool area & bar area to go upstairs to our room and everything looked very nice. We weren't expecting anything fancy but the pictures on the website are a bit misleading. The room was small with a bed and dresser, a small closet and a tiny bathroom. It was just the 2 of us, so the fact that it was small didn't really bother us...it was the dirt on the tile floor (like someone had swept but just pushed it all to the walls) and the ickyness of the bathroom. The bathroom was tiny and dingy. The grout in between the pink tiles was brown and black on both the bathroom floor and in the shower. The shower also had rust stains running down from the faucets. It was like they never scrubbed it down. Needless to say, neither of us took our shoes off...even in the shower. There was no clock and the small tv had bad reception. On the plus side, the A/C worked well and the bed was clean and comfortable. The Inn is only a block off the beach and the area seemed very safe. It was about a 15 minute walk to some great restaurants and the larger hotel/casinos. We walked back to the hotel each night well after midnight and never felt unsafe. Several other wedding guests were randomly upgraded to the Acacia and that hotel is very clean and much nicer. We tried to move over there but they wanted to charge us even more so we didn't bother. We were busy getting things ready for the wedding we were in that we didn't have much time to spend at the hotel anyway. Based on our experience, this is not a hotel I would stay at again nor would I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wind Chimes - happy with our stay there”
Reviews.Author: CINTraveler
Reviews.Content: We needed a short trip to get away from the midwest cold and decided on Wind Chimes Inn in San Juan. We avoid the large chain establishments and were happy enough with Wind Chimes. With the Inn being walled in, it helped to isolate us from the city (out trips are normally of the outdoor type with city stays only as places to stay between getting from here to there). There is a nice covered patio off the bar which came in handy on the rainy day we had - it was comfortable to sit there and read while we waited for the rain to stop. Pool is nice also. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was somewhat small but it was clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff was prompt and took good care things. The bar is comfortable although it was quite noisy in the evening. If you're an early to bed type, ask for a room as much isolated from the bar noise as possible. We had lunch (very limited menu) at the bar and it was quite good. Breakfasts are buffet style bagels, cereal, juice etc. & they will also cook eggs to order - nothing to write home about, but fast, convenient and certainly good enough. We had some trouble getting hot water in the shower but didn't complain. Don't know if it was our timing, our room, or if that's a general problem at the Inn. Location is good - not far to walk to restaurants & it's a short trip to & from the airport (if you stay here & take a taxi from the airport, have the Inn's address handy - our taxi driver had never heard of it) It's only a couple of blocks from the bus stop, so getting to Old San Juan is easy. We took the bus in, but took a taxi back for convenience. We would certainly stay there again, but would request something more isolated from the bar noise. Even when staying up late, it was rather bothersome ,but not so much that we complained.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler63
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Puerto Rico. I've been to a few Caribbean locations and have to say this was my most disappointing one. Weather was mostly cloudy all 6 days and windy, beaches were okay (waters were rough), food a bit pricey, and the Condado area I thought was a bit run down. Overall, Wind Chimes Inn was nice for the price I paid. However, I do wish I would have stayed a little further west in the heart of the Condado location (i.e., San Juan Marriott). The benefit of being at Wind Chimes, however, is that you are closer to the better beaces in the Condado area. If you walk about 5 to 10 minutes east of the hotel, you will find Ocean Park Beach...one of the nicer beaches within walking distance...the sand is much finer than the Condado Beach that is about 2 blocks north of the hotel. Oh....and bring your own (or buy) a beach towel; the towels provided at the hotel are not any larger than a bath towel. I was placed in a room in the courtyard on the first floor; would not recommend this; you can hear every noise. Restaurant recommendations: Omm (Argentian Grill) on Ashford (expensive), Cafe del Angel for Puerto Rican cuisine (inexpensive); Danny's International for breakfast food, pizza, burgers, sandwiches (inexpensive); Ceilito Lindo for Mexican (inexpensive). Inexpensive=$15-$20 for a meal. I would recommend renting a car one or two days to venture outside of San Juan. I as a single female traveling alone rented a car for an afternoon to visit the El Yunque Rain Forest.

Reviews.Title: “A great, casual Inn”
Reviews.Author: Zorro98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and we would return. The location is one block from the beach and a short walk from the hotel and commercial part of Condado - exactly where we wanted to be. It was a great value. The rooms here are very small and so is the swimming pool. If that's important to you then you might be unhappy here. Their other property, about half a block away, is The Acacia where you have access to the huge hot tub. We stayed at The Acacia on our way back through PR and liked it a lot but we preferred the casual friendliness of At Wind Chimes Inn as well as its slightly lower price that week. The outdoor bar serves a good breakfast and was a gathering spot in the evening for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant - nothing like other reviews”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkies500
Reviews.Content: The Wind Chimes Inn was the most unpleasant hotel I've used in many years. I chose the hotel based on reviews here on Trip Advisor, but found a very different place from what I had been led to expect. This shocked me since I've come to rely on Trip Advisor through the years and have always been able to add positive reviews from those experiences. To start, the check-in process was slow and cumbersome. It took the clerk a very long time to take care of the fairly simple needs of the party ahead of us in line, and just as long for our simple reservation. Eventually we were led to our room, but given no assistance with our luggage on the many steps up and down. Those who checked in ahead of us had to wait for us to be taken to our room before being taken to their room in a separate building down the street. The room was small and dingy, even for regional norms - and especially for the price. There was a lot of dirt between and on top of the vinyl tiles on the floor, peeling paint on the walls, and even a couple of roaches. The bed was uncomfortable, but usable and clean. It overlooked the hotel's bar and a street, so it was quite noisy until about midnight unless you closed the window and turned on the air conditioner. There was no deadbolt on the door, the door closed only loosely, and you could see light from the hall even with the door closed. The window blind was cracked and curtains weren't fully attached. Furnishings were very unattractive and crowded. The tiny TV only picked up two over the air stations (both in Spanish) with very weak signals. The bathroom was terrible. The sink only had cold water since the same supply pipe was connected to both the hot and cold water taps. The shower had very little pressure, a poor shower head, and missing and discolored wall tiles. The bathroom's window opened to the hall next to the stairs, so it couldn't be opened while maintaining privacy. While the hotel has wireless internet in the bar (and in our room due to its proximity to the bar), it took some effort to learn the passcode. The front desk clerk didn't know anything about it, and neither did the first person I asked in the bar area. Finally, one of the servers was able to provide the simple code. The hotel has a nice pool area, but some advertised features didn't work and it closed at 6 pm. It was just a short walk to the beach on a safe street, and was a reasonable distance from Condado restaurants. Transportation can be difficult as there seem to be very long intervals between buses, so be prepared to do a lot of walking. Needless to say, I won't be returning to this hotel on future trips to San Juan. There are many alternatives that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “perfect escape for a single woman”
Reviews.Author: graciouspeacock
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a five day reprieve from a brutal new york city winter and I found it. A friend told me about the inn, as he'd stayed there with his wife when they were dating, and I gave it a shot. It was perfect. The inn is intimate and lovely , and the staff is helpful and unobtrusive. It's a few minutes walk to a spectacular beach. Condaod and Old San Juan are nearby, but its just as relaxing to hang out by the pool and then sojourn to the Boat bar. it's called wind chimes because they have a nice upper level deck filled with countless different kinds of wind chimes, so you can sit in the evening with the tropical trade winds blowing, enjoy a cocktail and a book in peace while listening to the melodies. This place is far superior to one of the larger anonymous hotels nearby if yo're looking for a special getaway. It has a unique charm and is great for a little getaway, espcially if you're a single woman looking to just get away from it all for a little bit. the staff will watch out for you and help arrange trips or give heplful information.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures Are A Little Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Penelope7238
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting anything fancy but nonetheless were somewhat disappointed when our room - the most expensive out of the three places we stayed on our trip - turned out to be TINY, overrun with excess furniture, essentially in the basement and have an itty bitty teenie weenie bathroom. The room wasn't awful or dirty; however, our one window looked two feet across a dim hallway into someone else's window. Consequently we didn't want to open the curtains and so it was dark as a tomb regardless of how sunny it was outside. Our two suitcases barely fit in the room and we had to fashion a flat space out of two chairs for my husband to be able to open his. My bag stayed in the closet. And the bathroom, while functional, had the smallest shower I've ever seen and with no separator between the shower floor and the rest of the bathroom water would overspray to the sink and toilet. The bathroom door sort of an open design and provided no privacy for personal matters - at least there was a TV for some background noise. In terms of noise, our room also was right by the bar. It's a nice enough place to hang out - though pricey and they were out of most food items - but our second night there patrons stayed until 2 a.m. and calls to the front desk to complain about the noise went unanswered. Perhaps we as younger travelers got the short end of the stick and were given a shoddy room. I didn't complain about our accomodations to the staff. Maybe other rooms would have been more satisfactory. So that said - if you go make sure you get a high level room away from the bar. (There's one room that's actually UNDER the pool's lounge area and right by the compressor for the waterfall - ugh!) And forgo the hotel breakfast and walk down McLeary to Kasalta's for great local food. My husband and I took brunch each morning splitting a sandwich and large soup and dessert (the coconut flan is to die for). It's nothing fancy, but the food is good and Kasalta's is well-supported by people who live nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Simple, and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: AKFromColorado
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days in SJ. Wanted to be close to Old San Juan, a beach and also not pay too much. This was a great value. less than $100/night for a king sized bed about 2 blocks from the beautiful Ocean Park beach. And 2 blocks to the bus to Old San Juan. The room was SIMPLE, this is not a luxury hotel, it is a small family fun hotel. The grounds are clean, with a friendly cat. However, if you are used to a Hilton, you may be dissapointed. Our room was adequate, everything worked as expected, the bed was fine. We definately got what we paid for... what was above average was the service and personal touches. They have a small bar to the rear of the hotel, the bartender was one of the friendliest, helpful, locals I've encountered at any hotel. He reccomended great food and fesitvals nearby... The rest of the staff was equally friendly and helpful. Not the prettiest in town, but for the location and service, it can't be beat at their prices. (and it ain't ugly either, just simple ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Inn--Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTravelBug_4
Reviews.Content: I found At Wind Chimes Inn in the "Que Pasa?" magazine--a publication about touring Puerto Rico, which is very helpful! I checked it out online and loved their website, checked reviews on here and was even more excited. I called to book a room and was told that there was only an economy room left or a large king-size room (which was out of our budget). We'd been hoping for a queen, but settled for the economy. When we got to the Inn, we were so surprised and pleased to find we'd been upgraded to the KING room for the same price of the economy! It was so nice of them to do that and made us love them even more! The place is so very cute and nicely decorated. It is clean and feels just like you're staying at your grandma's (or whoever else makes you feel like you're right at home). It is located just two blocks from the beach and near great dining. There is off street parking---which is a little bit of a small area and costs extra--but we felt that our rental was safe. This place has a lot of character and we were treated with nothing but kindness! We hope to come back annually! The best thing is that it is a very classy place for a very affordable price. We're on a student budget and yet we were able to stay here--and comfortably!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Long Weekend Inn”
Reviews.Author: drew34
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for a 4 night long weekend in November and it was everything we could have asked for. The staff was incredibly friend and helpful. The hotel food was a bit pricey but absolutely delicious-thanks to the bar tender Danny. The location was great, close to bus routes, old San Juan and the beach. Our rooms was small but had everything we needed and was always clean. Overall I'd recommend to any couples traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRN
