Reviews.Content: We (a group of 17 of us including my husband and two children) stayed At Wind Chimes Inn for my sister's wedding for 5 nights. It was the perfect location.... close to the beach, close to restaurants, and a close walk from "larger" hotels/casino. We enjoyed the "authentic" feel of the hotel. We all enjoyed the pool (smaller, but large enough for us to enjoy). The staff was wonderful at helping arrange transportation for our large group. There is a bar onsite (on the expensive side) that serves food... the quesadilla is outstanding!! I would definately stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tritonlab
Reviews.Content: Granted, I was a little skeptical when I read all of the online reviews re this hotel. How could a hotel (inn) be this accomodating and pet friendly at the same time? Well, it definately met my expectations and even more. Although the room (room 127 again) was a little small and a little retro (think 1960's pink tiled bathrooms), it worked for me and my pet. The air conditioning worked at the turn of a dial and the bed was comfortable and the shower hot. I concur that all of the staff were absolutely wonderful and were available to answer any and all of your questions,, whether it be directions, dining recommendations or where to get a manicure locally. The best part about this hotel is that it is slightly off the beaten path of Condado, but less than a one block walk to the beach. A very dog friendly beach I might add. Parking is somewhat limited to the area streets, but no walk is more than a block. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillygal2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from Puerto Rico and our stay at At Wind Chimes was the best!!! The hotel is so quaint and unique, I would definitely go back again and bring my husband. I had only been to Puerto Rico one other time leaving for a cruise and really did not get a good sense of the place till I stayed this time. I loved the fact that wind chimes is in a residential area but a short walk to all the action! The people at the front desk are so helpful and we loved our bartender Manny. He really kept us entertained when we went to the bar to have a drink. Everyone couldn't have been nicer. We wanted to go to see Guavate and the local color on Sunday and the woman at the front desk suggested we rent a car rather than taking a taxi as the taxis are very expensive there. It turned out that we spent about half renting the car and I would recommend to anyone they take a trip to the mountains to check out the local scene....it was great! Loved the salsa dancing and pig roast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanCaptain
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel on a trip to Puerto Rico with my girlfriend. Had an excellent time; the staff was extremely helpful with advice about the area. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to see Puerto Rico and wants something a little more authentic than a large corporate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly quaint, happy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYGiantsFan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wind Chimes Inn and let me tell you, this is the most honestly charming, terrific hotel in San Juan. Cheap because it is not on the beach, but so close. The staff is genuinely friendly and happy to help. They recommend real local activities and/or tourist sight-seeing depending on your request. The pool is great, and never crowded since the hotel is small. Bathroom and storage in the lobby allow for late check out to be easy with no additional charges, as you don't need to hold up the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in PR!”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict2005
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great stay AT Wind Chimes and would recommend it to everyone. The hotel is adorable with lots of little unique touches. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpful. The best part of the hotel is the location, a block from the best beach, but we still enjoyed using the pool. And you can't beat the price! We will definetely be staying here the next time we return to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PokaPHace
Reviews.Content: We got to the Wind Chimes and the lady at the desk told us that they upgraded us for free to a Queen sized bed and ocean view!...But they moved us to their sister hotel right up the block at the Acacia. The place was beautiful! For the price we paid...I wasn't expecting what we got. Palmira at the front desk was great! To the owner of Acacia: If you're reading this...give her a raise!!! She reminded me of a family member who really wanted us to have a great time. She recommended a lot of great stuff and saved us a bunch of money on tours. We visited from Sep 3rd to the 5th for our Anniversary. We ate our anniversary dinner at the restaurant at the Acacia and it was amazing. It was pretty pricey so plan to spend around $100 for 2 people but it was worth it. And the hotel was only about 100 feet from the beach! Perfect trip. The only thing negative I have to say about our trip (has nothing to do with the hotel)...is the food in PR. You can get most of the food here in the states.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: petesamless
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at theWind Chimes if you are looking for big hotel amenities or a huge pool DO STAY at the Wind Chimes if you are looking for a quiet get away with cosy nooks and crannies and a lovely but small pool with a waterfall. We stayed at the Wind Chimes for two weeks and have only good things to say about our stay. We had the smallest room in the hotel but it was large enough for all of our needs. The staff was friendly and always there to assist. The fabulous beach was only a two minute walk and everything you need from restaurants to bus stops for that mandatory trip to old San Juan was within easy walking distance. We loved Puerto Rico and would go again staying at the At Wind Chimes in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, affordable gem”
Reviews.Author: laschus
Reviews.Content: A trip to San Juan was set as a birthday present for my girlfriend, and I wanted to find a place that would be fun and enjoyable without spending too much. I could tell by the squeal of delight she let out when she got into the room ahead of me that I hit my mark. Decorated in festive carribean motifs, the rooms at At Wind Chimes gave a feel of authenticity without going overboard. The stone tile floor was a bit much as it was uncomfortable to walk on, but on the whole the interiors were very delightful and exceedingly comfortable for the price. Our trip was, unfortunately, during a heavy rainy season and we didn't get out as much as we would have liked but the room gave us a pleasant and comfortable base to return to. We found the staff to be very helpful, including loaning us an umbrella for the day to protect us from the inclement weather. The proximity to the beach was very convenient and it is within a short bus ride to the center of the bustling Condado area. The only down side was the extremely limited parking area available within the neighborhood, and paying for parking in their very small lot meant having to shuffle automobiles to get out and about. Still, that was a small price to pay for a wonderful and affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: redmilton
Reviews.Content: poor customer service they do not respond to follow up emails, reserved a parking space that was given away. parking nightmare. Never stayed there due to their negligence in giving parking space away, cancelled my reservation due to their error and was still charged one night stay

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this place”
Reviews.Author: dognamedrabbit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 3 nights at "At Wind Chimes", and absolutely loved it. Our room was lovely (and big!), with huge windows and a little balcony. We were overlooking the courtyard and never heard any noise, even the first night when we slept with the windows open. The overall atmosphere is very casual and relaxing...there are nice sitting areas outside of almost every room, the roof top deck above the bar was beautiful. The pool area is very nice, we would have full run of it most days when we came back from the beach (beach is only a short block away and they offer beach chairs to rent). Each bartender was friendly, and very informative of the area. The inn felt very intimate, and was so much better than any big resort hotel I have stayed in the past. Is in easy walking distance to Ocean Park (to the east), and the main part of Condado Beach (to the west). Ask the bartenders about Plaza Mercado on Thurs. and Saturdays, it was within walking distance and really cool. On Calle Los Banos, a few blocks to the east, there is a small local restaurant where you can get very cheap egg breakfast ($7.00 for two people), and keep going a couple more blocks east to Pinky's where you can get some of the best sandwiches you've ever tasted. In the same block as the hotel, one block south is a restaurant (the name slips my mind), that serves yummy Cuban food with local specialties like Mofongo. Ummo's in Condado Beach was a great meal as well. And for those that need it....there's a Starbucks a couple of blocks west. Overall, our stay was unbelievable. Most times we felt like we had the place all to ourselves. We would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JKell83
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a while ago, tried to go back recently but it was sold out!!! Anyway, this is a great place. Close to the beach, nice swimming pool, helpful staff who let us shower after checkout and holding our luggage all day. Bartender made us great drinks! Good times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SamandJanet
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet place in a great location, just a short block from San Juan's Condado Beach. Modest room just off the inner courtyard with a tiny bathroom. Clean and contained, a short walk from restaurants, buses, oh....and did I say the beach?! Helpful and friendly staff, EZ reservations, really good and fresh food at the "poolside" bar. The room smelled musty at first but fans and a few minutes of AC took care of it. Some noise off the courtyard-people coming in late at night-but not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off, Were You?”
Reviews.Author: Flightmuffin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We chose this one because of mostly positive reviews, location, and what we felt was a very good room rate. The hotel was just ok. Not quite as 'quaint' as I had hoped for. We stayed in room 101, which was right by the lobby area and front door. Very noisy late at night as other guest were retuning. The front door does not close quietly!! They offered a continental breakfast for purchase...$11.95!!! It only included bagels, pastries, fruit, juice and coffee. (I don't think so...!) Parking was a nightmare and we weren't there on a weekend. When we made our reservation the manager said she would put us down for a reserved spot (for $10/day). When we arrived, there wasn't a spot for us. Guess she forgot. My biggest disappointment was with our final bill. First, at check in we were charged in full for all 3 nights. We were only given the charge receipt, not a detailed bill. When we were leaving, my husband requested a detail bill. WELL.....in addition to the $85/night that we had been quoted,there was a "other" charge of $ 42 and taxes. I have called about this 'other charge' and was awkwardly told it was taxes. We know that is not right. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, laid back feel”
Reviews.Author: AZJOHN1
Reviews.Content: After reading so many concerns about the property, I decided to see it for myself before committing. I stayed at the Embassy Suites (Isla Verde/Carolina...reviewed separately) upon first arriving and asked to see a room at Windchimes. Everything at the property (room, plumbing, pool, etc.) was in good condition, and I found some of the criticisms listed here to be harsh and/or exaggerated. The 2nd floor water pressure was adequate, and there was always hot water for me. I bathe at dinner time. Maybe it's different if you are showering in the morning along with lots of other people. I paid $85 for a standard (queen) room and later had to move to a king size room for $125 a night. This is off-season. The people who complain about the price being too high apparently don't know what rooms are going for at the chain hotels in town ($175 and up, with huge amounts of tax and "resort fees" added on.) The atmosphere is casual and quiet. There are lovely sitting areas, some sunny and others cozy and covered. The rooms are small, but I was no happier in the large room compared to the smaller one. I stayed just above the lobby and did hear some noise on occasion. The air conditioner or fan masked the noise, though. I can see how the rooms right next to the lobby would be noisy. After a few days, I noticed there are tiny cameras everywhere on the property, which is good for security, I guess. The free wi-fi usually did not work in the room, only in the lobby and bar, but the clerks were upfront about this. The location is great. I like to walk, and if you walk a block south, you are on a main street of a real local neighborhood. A block north, you're at a nice beach. A lot of restaurants, casinos, hotels, shops, etc. were about a 1/2 mile west. If you don't like to walk, then you probably will have to choose between the erratic bus service or expensive taxis. There's no entertainment or shopping right there. Most people say you should rent a car in San Juan, but traffic is a nightmare; parking is worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to the beach”
Reviews.Author: TravelingButterfly
Reviews.Content: I definitely agree with the reviewer below me. It's a great location to the beach, but it's a good 15 minute walk to get to the main strip where the restaurants are. The bus is the BEST bet to get to Old San Juan - it's just 75 cents, but they only come every 20-30 mins. A cab is about $13-14. We had our reservation at the At Wind Chimes, but like a lot of people, got upgraded to the Acacia - which, in my opinion, was MUCH nicer!! We got a FREE upgrade, mind you, with a gorgeous balcony suite. There is zero parking on the street, nor do they have a parking lot (the At Wind has a lot for $10 a day, not worth it IMO). Definitely get any advice from FELIX at the front desk (Acacia) - he can recommend eateries, things to do, what to avoid, etc. Definitely go to Kasalta bakery for breakfast (10 min walk, opposite way of the Old City). And unlike a previous post, skip Bebo's cafe (it's Bebo's not Beso's). It's Dominican owned, and they have the WORST service ever. The food wasnt even worth it. Going into Old San Juan - eat at Lupi's Mexican Restaurant - so good!!!! I thought the rooms were really nice, we stepped out and had the jacuzzi right by our room. The pool is at the At Wind (you have access to both hotels) and the sandwiches and chips/salsa are excellent at the bar! You MUST go to the waterfall (El Yunque) - if you rent a car it's only a 25 min ride. I dont know how much a cab is. It's not far though.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Little Affordable Spot if Your Focus is Beach”
Reviews.Author: Travellifenow
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend a few weeks ago and had a decent stay. The highlights were the staff was friendly and helpful, the cozy atmosphere of the inn, and I loved the acerola (cherry juice) that they had at the bar. The rooms were clean, although I didn't love the shower solution. You should definitely bring shower shoes. The biggest plus was the proximity to a nice stretch of beach. If my goal was to really get solid beach time - I would stay there again, especially if I was going it alone. The challenge is that in terms of location to Condado's restaurants and main strip - it isn't that close. You'll definitely do a 15/20 minute walk, cab for $8 minimum, or the bus. The cab and bus can be easy (front desk calls cab - and they come in like 3-5 minutes), the bus schedule is hit or miss. So overall - if I wanted to explore more restaurants or be closer to Old San Juan, I'd stay nearer to the Marriott or Condado Plaza. Other than that - it was a great find - you get what you pay for, but this was worth it, and a good intro to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Inn”
Reviews.Author: MyaniqueD
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at Wind Chimes Inn during an impromptu vacation. We decided on Puerto Rico since we hadn't visited that island yet. (We travel through the caribbean quite a bit). We needed somewhere clean, near to the beach, with good staff and as inexpensive as possible. Wind Chimes was pretty good in all these areas. The room we stayed in was about the size of a standard bedroom, located upstairs w King Size bed and a bathroom. The water pressure wasn't that great, i guess because we were upstairs, and the hot water was intermittent. That wasn't a problem for us because this is a pretty standard situation in the caribbean unless you're in a big hotel. Bathroom was fairly clean, and our towels and linens were changed daily. Cable TV available in the room, and my friend picked up the internet on her laptop. The swimming pool is really just there to wade around and cool off in. Very small, but i liked it. There is a separate tanning area above the pool as well. The staff is awesome, we found ourselves hungry late one night and the chef/bartender Angel fixed my friend a tasty vegetarian pizza and i had a chicken quesadilla. AWESOME!!! The front desk staff is also really helpful with area information. The hotel is literally a block from the beach. The Condado beach is choppy and the sand isn't as nice as you would find in Negril, Jamaica but for Puerto Rico it was ok. Isla Verde beach is much nicer and not as many teeny boppers about. There were good restaurants to choose from. A five minute walk takes you to a Dominican Restaurant called Beso's. The french eatery La Patisserie was also excellent, the Quiche was amazing. Although my friend insists that the lunch meats there gave her a virus. (I recommend eating cooked meats in foreign countries...newho). 10 -15 minute walk takes you to a wide array of other eating areas, including Uno's Pizza, Starbucks, and other selections. We followed the suggestion to take the bus to Old San Juan and that worked out well for us, since we didn't feel like spending the extra money for a cab. Be prepared to be disappointed with the Bacardi tour, personally had I known what i do now, I would have skipped it. Basically you get 2 drink vouchers, then you take a trolley to the 'tour', Which is essentially videos and pictures, and then you get sent over to a drink expert who tells you how to make Mojito's, Cuba Libre and Daiquiri's. Then it;s over to the gift shop. That's it. No tour of the actual facility or taste testing or view of the estate. All in all, i would recommend Wind Chimes for singles, laidback, adventurous, flexible persons.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice & Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRvacationer
Reviews.Content: This small hotel offered us just what we needed. We got married on Condado Beach (Near the Gucci store and beautiful fountain) on March 31, 2008. This hotel was excellent because it offered us the peace and quiet that we needed prior to our wedding. It felt as though it was our own private hotel. When we took pictures the morning of our wedding, we were not interrupted and we did not have to worry about people getting in the way of our photos. The hotel staff was amazing! Ms. Evelyn helped with everything from the preacher to the guide that helped us legalize our destination wedding. The bar staff was great also. They felt like they were family members! We don't drink, but when we needed a late night snack they offered to make a variety of treats. They also catered to our family members the same way when they came to visit. We really appreciate their kindness. We definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you're looking for a quiet place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it---but didn't.”
Reviews.Author: Louie74
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to book this place, since I only read good reviews, but I was very disappointed in our room. It was very clean but ended up being the size of a postage stamp, the bed literally filled the whole room. We packed light, only two carry-on bags each for the two of us, but there was no place to put them. We had to stack everything on a chair in the corner and after 6 days the cramped space got very old. After a couple of nights we asked if there was anything else available and they said no, even though it was the middle of the week and we just saw a handful of people throughout our whole stay, but since we were in beautiful Puerto Rico, we weren't in the mood to argue. On the up side, the location was completely safe, we walked everywhere and stayed out on the beach til midnight every night without any problems. We also found a great place for breakfast called Kasalta, it's more like a bakery than a restaurant, but very good. The staff may recommend Pinky's, but we say nooo way. Everything just felt not right about that place, and I'm all about eating from vendors and kiosks, but that place was way too dirty feeling. So enjoy Puerto Rico, it was our first visit and we loved it!! If you don't mind extremely tight quarters I guess you should stay at Wind Chimes, but it really isn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “looking for a bargain? cheap but go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bsurfsd
Reviews.Content: barely adequate facility offset by friendly helpful staff - stay could have been unpleasant but you make the best of things and have fun anyway altho i would not reccommend going here. everything is VERY claustrophobic, they wouldn't honor the rate quoted me and charged $75 more because they hadn't sent me an email confirmation. (like i was supposed to know i needed it to be in an email?) Cats fighting under my window on the first night sounded like sombody torturing a kid. air conditioner had no temp setting, so it was either on or off. overhead fan had 5 speeds, starting at paper blowing speed and getting faster. inhouse bar restaurant was terrrible food. only people using it were newcomers who would only go once. Our Gyro didn't use fresh ingredients, greasy meat, stale pita bread and definately not prepared as advertised in the menu. unit kitchenette very bad. freezer didn't work, no micro, no toaster, only elec stove. utensils, pots, pans, etc all in a box under the sink. bathroom so small i had to sit sideways on the crapper or fit knees under the sink. sink has a shelf only twelve inches above it so whatever you do be it brush teeth, rinse face, etc becomes dificult and mirror is on wall behind toilet so shaving involves a lot of turning around to see whats going on. lots of steps with very narrow passage ways. pool is pretty in foto but i've seen bigger bathtubs and it only holds three people in the entire pool area. location not bad. not good, but not bad. no windows to speak of as they are louvered and topped by plants so neighbors can't see in. i talked to some neighbors and their unit was literally a cave beinbg under the pool overlook decking and they had only one window that couldn't be used, their stove burners didn't all work and when you opened their door it was dark and illumination was too feeble to make it in any way comfotable. their 80 yr old parents were in an upstairs unit which due to narrow steep stairs made their stay less than pleasant, etc etc etc. Bottom Line is pay the extra $30-$40 a night and go somewhere else where you can feel like a human being and have an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: aceserve2001
Reviews.Content: My wife's pants were ruined when she walked past a hotel worker scrubbing what turned out to be bleach onto a sidewalk. The pants got splattered. When she went to inform the hotel staff, they hinted she was lying, said she had no proof and did not even offer an apology. They then threatened to call the police. We did not stay at the hotel, but this gives you an inkling of the kind of people they employ.

Reviews.Title: “Great time At Wind Chimes”
Reviews.Author: skipus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Puerto Rico and six nights At Wind Chimes Inn as part of a group of about 25 people attending a wedding and reception in Old San Juan. This inn is a great place to stay if you want an alternative to the large resort hotel atmosphere while still being close to the beach (a five minute walk) and near many nice shops, restaurants and casinos. It is located in a residential neighborhood , and the whole property has a cozy B&B feel to it. Although not overly friendly, the staff is competent and efficient (Felix at the front desk is the star of the group); the rooms are attractive, clean, but not luxurious, and a little smaller than some people may prefer. We don't spend a lot of time in the room, so it worked out perfectly fine for us; if you expect to do more than sleep, shower, and sit in rattan style chairs and watch TV or read a little after a busy day, you will probably be disappointed. The pool area and elevated sun terrace are near the street but a stone wall surrounds the area to provide some privacy. The boat bar a few steps away provides a welcome oasis with a limited menu (breakfast and lunch) and reasonable prices for food and drinks. The bar tenders were very friendly and the whole place has a very laid back, casual feeling to it. Unlike some other reviewers, our whole group did not feel nickel and dimed to death ; we felt they gave us good value for the prices they charged. Driving and parking in San Juan is a REAL CHALLENGE, so you might want to think twice about renting a car unless you plan on visiting other parts of the island. Although the cab fares do add up, it's the way to get around here if you go somewhere beyond walking distance. Public transportation is available and cheap, but we found it took a lot of time to get anywhere; service is a little erratic sometimes. All in all, we had a wonderful stay here. Be sure to visit their sister property down the street (the Acacia). Windchimes guests can take advantage of their huge hot tub area and fine restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in San Juan - I have another recommendation”
Reviews.Author: eagle2435
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon for our Puerto Rico trip. We felt we paid too much for what we received. First of all, it seems like Wind Chimes Inn charges about 25% tax when everyone else on the island charges about 9%. We paid over $150 per night with taxes included when we only booked the room for $120 per night - do the math, that is a ton of "taxes". We didn't know better though, because it was the first hotel we stayed in. The room was nicely decorated but pretty small - also, we were given a room right beside the lobby and the front door, even though we told the lady at check-in that we were on honeymoon and wanted some peace and quiet. This definitely caused some problems, what with the spring breakers slamming doors and yelling in the lobby til about 3:30 am every night and the hotel not doing anything to calm the freaks down. Nothing is complimentary and you WILL get nickel and dimed more than anywhere else. Also, the hot water seemed to be non-existent half of the time - take a quick shower if you stay here. It is close to the beach and shops and restaurants which is nice. Also - no parking unless you want to pay $10 per day, and it is pretty difficult to find a spot near the Inn. All in all, the Inn is clean and nicely decorated, but we felt it is overpriced and doesn't offer very good service or value. As a recommendation, we stayed at another hotel in San Juan called the Oceana Hostal Playero on the latter part of our trip and enjoyed a much quieter, nicer, and much less expensive stay. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel 7 helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FAAM
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I stayed for 7 days and found the service to be friendly and welcome. We were initially booked at Wind Chime but was "upgraded" on arrival. Turned out to be a pleasant surprise. Our room was quite small...but never planned on being in it much anyways. Had a good view...easy access to the LARGE hot tub, which we used nightly. Restaurant in hotel was absolutely fabulous...amazing food & great service! Make sure you make a reservation, well worth your time and money. Beach was 1 minute walk away...clean, large with a stunning sunset. At Wind Chimes had a small but pleasant boat bar...friendly service..but a little pricey. Lots of restaurants, shopping, pharmacies, etc, within a couple blocks. We really enjoyed the greek restaurant just up the road. We rented a car to explore...well worth it...but be careful driving...drivers tend to be impatient.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the wind chimes....”
Reviews.Author: lifesavermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two very young children stayed at the Wind Chimes Inn for four nights, January 29-Feb 2nd. It is a cozy, beautiful little hacienda in the heart of San Juan. Only a short walk to Condado beach. The staff are helpful and knowlegeable; anytime we needed something, they were there IMMEDIATELY. I have heard that some rooms are very small, tv's are small, etc. However, we had a beautiful King room with a decent sized tv and a little kitchenette. It was cozy and comfortable. There was a fold out futon for our 4 year old to sleep on, and the front desk staff immediately brought extra sheets and blankets for him. The food at the Boat Bar is very good, as are the drinks! It was easy to take a short walk to Bebo's Cafe, the bus stop, the beach or a drug store. I felt very at home at the Wind Chimes and would definitely stay there again. The only imperfections: our room was right next to the boat bar (as my husband says, the bar was in our living room--we actually had to walk through it to get to our room) and it got a bit noisy in the am for us 10am risers. The noise at night didn't bother us. Also parking is VERY limited; you can pay $10/night if you have a compact car to park in the tiny gated lot---but there is only space for 4 vehicles. Otherwise, you're fighting for space on the side street, which is no easy task. I loved the Wind Chimes and have wonderful memories there now. Will probably stay again on our next trip! I am in love with Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel - We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Lovinlife1245
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wind Chimes Inn, San Juan from 1/30/08 to 2/2/08 prior to departing on a cruise. This is a charming hotel with an attentive staff. The room was not large but very clean and pleasant. We had Room 106 on the first floor just off the courtyard. You enter the hotel thru a wooden door just off the street. There are about 8 stairs leading to the entrance foyer. The front desk reception is off to your right and although small it is still functional. There are french doors off the reception area leading out to the small pool and water fountain area. There are two floors to the Inn but we didn't explore the second floor. After checking in, we went directly to our room down a small hallway to a courtyard. The courtyard had small tables and chairs and lots of potted plants. There were also large concrete fish sitting by the potted plants. The rooms are small with colorful bedspreads. Each room has a ceiling fan and a/c. The bathroom is exceptionally small with a shower only. All the floors are tile. The room was clean and comfortable and suited our needs for a 2 night pre cruise stay. Even though there is a three night minimum, it was cheaper for us to do that than to pay over $280 a night elsewhere. Breakfast isn't included but can be purchased at the Boat Bar in the rear of the property. Very friendly staff at the bar. The A5 bus to Old San Juan is close by and easy to use. The beach is very close and easily walkable from the hotel. I would stay here again. There is only one drawback and that is the lack of restaurants in the area that are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum069
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation to PR and the accomodations at Wind Chimes inn were very nice for a less expensive room (120/night). Staff were helpful and pleasant (printed off our boarding passes). Room 108 was smaller but clean. Fan & AC worked well. Pool was small and cold. The sister hotal (Acacia) had a hot tub that was warm at best. Traffic was loud at times. Balcony/sun deck was a nice area to relax in. Boat bar was convienent and pleasant. Condado beach area was rough surf. Best beach area was by the mariott. We took 2 days and went to Isle Vieques, ferry from Fajardo (2$/person). Beautiful island and beaches. Stayed at "CASA ALTA VISTA" in Esperanza. Nice hotel. Very helpful staff. Very nice little town. Blue beach was the best. Navio beach was also excellent. Need a 4-wheel drive!! Next time we wil stay in Esperanza. Perfect island experieince. Wild horses have run of the island. FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn”
Reviews.Author: erric101
Reviews.Content: This is a great charming Hotel. If you request room 120 you even get you own private terrace overlooking the pool and sun deck. Ginny and the staff are excellent. Getting around was easy. Don't take cabs to Old San Juan. Instead walk to the bus stop and for .75 take the J21 bus. Also for Bacardi Tour. Tak the j21 to Old San Juan and then take the .50 ferry and then a $3 shuttle. Total cost is $7 for one person round trip. Also EB Tours has a great trip to the Rainforest and to Loquillo Beach which is beautiful. Again I would retun in a heartbeat. Great job Wind Chimes.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience - find a hostel, even if you're older”
Reviews.Author: kmadski21
Reviews.Content: This was my second experience staying at At Wind Chimes Inn. The first time it was a nice experience but this trip was horrible. Upon contacting the Inn, they apologized but didn't offer to help at all. Here were some of our problems from our stay: -On night one, there was a loud commotion in the lobby and the door across from us. It turned out to be someone dressed like a prostitute demanding money from two men in the room. They argued for over 40 minutes which should have been dealt with by someone in the lobby since our rooms were practically in the lobby. -Hot water â€“ we had no hot water in our room throughout the entire stay there. Upon requesting why at the front desk, we were unable to obtain a reason or assistance and were told to shower in the lobby. -Check out- We were not informed of our check out time at any point. Presumably it is because there was no paperwork printed out upon check in as the printer was broken. When we checked out at noon, we found out that we had to pay an extra $20 for the hour (25% of the room rate). -Services/your service book- after trying to obtain information about church services was next to impossible. The people working the front desk the Sunday we stayed refused to help us other than to say, â€œif itâ€™s not in the book then we donâ€™t knowâ€�. After some discussion, we tried to attend a service that was listed in their guide book and the church was closed as the service no longer existed. - The one positive I'd say was that their adventure travel recommendation was good. He took us on a great trip to the rain forest and he was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: stephenmac
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Inn and were very happy with the room, the service, the staff, the location and the on site restaurant (The Boat Bar). The room was medium size with a comfortable queen bed, quiet, and the bathroom had good water pressure in the shower with no shortage of hot water. Located one block from a very nice beach, easy walking distance to bus lines, to Condado, and to the wonderful Kasalta Bakery. The food at The Boat Bar was surprisingly good where Angel really made the best mojitos we had in San Juan (Cuban style he said). The pool is smallish but comfortable and fun. There are 2 separate sun decks and a covered wind-chime deck. The neighborhood seemed safe, we had no problems walking around. We would definitely recommend this as a place to stay. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth and Charm at Wind Chimes!”
Reviews.Author: theaj
Reviews.Content: Wind Chimes had all the charm and warmth we were looking for in San Juan and was a good jumping off place for other island destinations. Located in a quiet Condado neighborhood just a block from the beach and a few minutes walk to restaurants and shopping, Wind Chimes is an excellent alternative to the noise and glitz of the tourist beat. Staff goes out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. Rooms are comfortable and clean. (Our king sized bed was amazingly sleepworthy!) The Boat Bar, serving delicious light fare all day long, is a convenient, palate-pleasing feature. Every one of the gifted gentlemen serving there made us feel like family! Nearby is the newly opened 'Niche' restaurant in Acacia, Wind Chimes' sister facility. Not only is the food there beautifully prepared and presented, but the decor is also a delight to the eye. Wind Chimes is great place to come back to -- we're already planning the next trip and would recommend it to anyone looking for a little home away from home in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but I would not return.”
Reviews.Author: Himelda
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice and the place is close to the beach, well maintained and clean, but I found several things that I disliked: a) On arrival they charged our credit card for the eight days we were staying there. It felt like we were prisoners and could not change our minds if we did not like the place. I suppose if they do not charge the credit card most people would consider going somewhere else. b) The room where breakfast is served looks nice in the web sites but the reality is different. It is dark, not too clean and does not feel cozy. There are tables on a second floor which are somewhat better but the service to these tables is mediocre at best. c) There are lots of additional charges: there is a tax on the breakfast bill that you only find out you have to pay on the last day, it is not included in the receipt you sign at breakfast each day. The chairs that you can take to the beach are $3. Whenever you call a taxi you pay a tourist fee which is much higher than what the meter shows. So, all additional expenses added together make this place as expensive as one of the good hotels closer to town and to the good beaches and restaurants. d) You are not really on Condado beach which is the nice beach. You are on a block from a beach that is mostly used by surfers and where very few people go swimming. e) The pool is small and receives little sun because there are several buildings that surround the house and keep the pool in the shade. f) The neighborhood has a few restaurants but the shops and the more commercial areas are not on walking distance. My suggestion is that you stay here only if you have a car and if you like large waves and surfing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kiaprnllgaymn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long stay at the Wind Chimes Inn in San Juan , Condado area and we loved it. The service there was spectacular. Everyone was so pleasant and went out of their way to ensure our stay was comfortable. Ginny and Evelyn were great. A special thanks to Ginny who was exceptional. My husband and I married there and had difficulty locating a venue. Ginny went out of her way to find us the perfect venue, which was the Wind Chimes sister hotel. We really enjoyed our stay there overall. We loved the intimacy of the inn and appreciated the privacy. It was so serene and relaxing. We want to extend our gratitude to the staff there at WInd Chimes and cant wait til next year when we return. Thanks again for everything. Sincerely, The Gaymons

Reviews.Title: “So-So at Wind Chimes”
Reviews.Author: Bill_and_Nives
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small but clean. The walls are paper thin so you hear everything from everywhere. We were shocked at the taxes and fees - 9% sales tax, 5% Energy surcharge and $2 per night per person charge. None of these were disclosed ahead of time, so the $90 night a room was over $106. Also parking would cost $10 per night plus taxes - we parked right next to the hotel on the road for free without problem. The staff would only recommend the restaurant at their sister site (it was good, but very overpriced). We walked to Bebo's (about 3 blocks away) for a very reasonable breakfast. The on site restaurant is hit and miss - they actually turned us away for dinner as they did not have fresh produce... Don't bother with the hotel tours - very expensive also. We rented a car from Charlies for 3 days for $75 and went to the rain forest and Arecibo - both very well marked...

Reviews.Title: “Puerto RIco Rocks”
Reviews.Author: SparkyKidMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Had a small room, nothing fancy, but wasn't in it much anyways. Bar area is noisy, especially with people using the ice machine, but it is what it is. Front desk staff are pretty helpful and friendly. Inn itself is pretty with lots of flowers, hidden corners and a real Spanish feel. Beach just a block away and has a strong surf, which makes it fun. Definitely go to Old San Juan(try to go twice) and rent a car and go to the El Yunque Rain Forest and Luquillo Beach. Also go to the Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico which is just a few blocks away. Small, but very diverse and beautiful museum. Puerto Rico's real treasures are its people, who are generally warm and friendly. While there, a local we barely knew bought us dinner and an elderly gentleman paid my bus fare when I asked him if he had change for a dollar, among other great interactions we had with the people of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a long stay. Don't park here.”
Reviews.Author: qtkt620
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early October. The staff was friendly. The biggest problem we had was that the parking was ridiculous. Not only is the parking limited, but you have to park 4 cars by stacking them and parking as close to the wall as possible. I am very surpised our rental was not completely scratched! You do not just park in a row, but rather with about 6 inches on either side for cars to maneuver around and between the other cars. The rooms are not as pictured. That is their renovated hotel. The room we were in (queen-sized bed) had about six inches on one side of the bed (dresser on the other) and when you opened the door to the room, teh door would hit the lamp (there was no room). Smallest room I've stayed in. My cruise room was larger! The showers were nice nad the decor was simple and clean. We would recommend this hotel for those who will be staying longer and are willing to use a kitchen. Don't get a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: eh80
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at Wind Chimes Inn. It is a beautiful hotel within walking distance of the beach. The room I was in was small but clean and comfortable. It was close to the bar so it was nosiy at times. The pool was beautiful with a littel water fall. I also loved the fact that the hotel was inclosed inside a wall with the rooms off court yards and little hallways. Had a very tropical feel! The staff were very helpful. However there was one woman who made me feel like I was wasting her time by asking where to catch the bus to Old San Juan. The other staff were very happy to book a day trip for me and to call a taxi to the airport. I would definatly stay here agian!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable and Cheap (in the off-season)!”
Reviews.Author: MLR_2007
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! The hotel is gorgeous; charming, very clean and well-maintained. The pool is small, but really lovely with a little waterfall. There was only one staff member who was sort of lazy with her suggestions as to where to eat, etc., but everyone else was great. They helped us get on public transportation, moved our luggage for us, and were quick with recommendations. We agreed to change rooms twice. For five days we paid $75 per night for a large room, queen bed, separate seating area, and then stayed one night in a smaller room for the same price. This room was same as the first one but without the separate seating area. The last room we stayed in was huge, with a king bed and kitchenette; I believe that cost $130. The bar staff is great. They were friendly but not overly so, generous, and their food was delicious! They even make their own balsamic vinegar. And they sqeeze oranges right in front of you for any drinks you might order that contain orange juice. The bar is very quaint-looking -- it is open to the courtyard rather than being indoors. The beach is a block away from the hotel. When we were there it was pretty empty. The ocean was a little rough because at that point we weren't near a bay, nor were there any retaining walls. The hotel staff will probably recommend you eat at Bebo's, but there is a restaurant called Jataca that is across the street from BeBo's and a few steps down (to the west) that has great food for very cheap. All in all we had a wonderful time. We got to experience a less tourist-sanitized P.R. than one would experience staying in a Holiday Inn or on a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: lsrrain
Reviews.Content: All of the great reviews of this hotel were very accurate - my son & I stayed at the Wind Chimes & we were not disappointed! It was exactly like the pictures portrayed, beautiful little spanish-hyacinda style hotel. It was very cozy, very clean and very safe. We walked the block to the beach w/ no problems. I was a little concerned about walking to restaurants during the evenings but we were assured it was safe so we did and had absolutely no problems. The area is heavily policed. Our room was always cleaned thoroughly, it was easy to get the bus to Old San Juan, the Acacia w/ the jacuzzi is phenominal! Stay there if you can but either place is wonderful! The beach is so clean w/ white sand & blue water - there is a great restaurant a block from the hotel, forgot the name but it's right beside the gas station on the corner. They had THE BEST Tres Leche cake - coffee is excellent in Puerto Rico, anywhere you go. The Boat Bar food is a little pricey but it was always good - my son loved the "All Hands" sanwiches. The bartenders always worked hard to make a beautiful presentation of the food. Don't forget to tip them! I loved this hotel & would recommend to anyone visiting sunny P.R.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Inn”
Reviews.Author: Beach999
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year old son and I stayed a few days prior to a trip to Tortola. We would stay here again. This is a nice small intimate hotel and the rooms and staff particularly in the bar were great. We arrived after 10:00 pm after the food service so the bartender took it upon himself to call a local restaurant he knew of to see if they were still open so we could feed our hungry son. The beach is close and very nice. Condado is within walking distance, however there is a lot of construction going there. The pool is small and though they have a posted closing hour of 6:00, we did use it later.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: karyn_carlo
Reviews.Content: Even though the Condado area. on the whole, is a bit depressed, this inn still maintains a homey, welcoming, feeling. The rooms are quite comfortable and the unique "beachy" decor is a welcome change from the mass produced hotel look. The pool is small, but nice and you have access to a HUGE jacuzzi in a nearby inn as well. The beach is gorgeous and only a block away. If you are looking for a place that is less expensive and less "touristy" choose wind chimes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jerryandsusan32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent July 8 - July 12 at Wind Chimes and wish we had planned to stay longer. This is a beautiful inn in a lovely setting. Our room was very nice - yes, the bathroom is small but who cares when you're in such a great place. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful - especially the young lady who helped us when Tropic Tours decided to cancel our tour to El Junques. She put us in touch with Raphael, PR4Less, and he was wonderful. We toured El Junques, went to a peaceful local beach, and thoroughly enjoyed the bioluminescence tour in Fajardo. Also ask them for recommendations of restaurants, things to see and do, etc. Pamela's is wonderful for a special dinner. Now, to the one thing that sets At Wind Chimes totally apart from other lovely inns - THE BOAT BAR! The young men who work there are personable, friendly, helpful, wonderful cooks, and excellent bar tenders!! I cannot say enough about them as a group or as individuals. They even worried about us when we didn't stop by one evening. Freddy makes absolutely the best Mojito I've ever tasted. We will definitely return and recommend At Wind Chimes highly. Susan and Jerry Webb

Reviews.Title: “I had an fantastic vacation at the Wind Chimes inn”
Reviews.Author: khymmnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wind Chimes Inn July 5th thru 9th. If you are looking for a clean, affordable and quiet place to relax. Then definitely check them out when in San Juan..It's a block if that from the ocean and you can use also use their sister property hot tub Acacia. I didn't know what to expect being my first trip to San Juan and solo at that. But I took the bus downtown. I walked around the neighborhood and everyone I came in contact with was extremely helpful with directions and tips on places to eat and visit. Can't wait to return in December.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice and happy both times”
Reviews.Author: BaechLover
Reviews.Content: The Wind Chimes is great if you want to go to Peurto Rico and not spend a fortune on your accomodations. The parking can be a pain, this is an urban area, I would not recommend a car unless you really plan to go around the island. Tours are availble and well worth the price. The buzzer at the door is for your own safety. One person was diappointed that there was no room service, but the bar will bring your food to your room if you ask. I was skeptical of the bar's food at first sight, because it so small, but it was delicious. We have eaten breakfast, lunch, and dinner there many times, and it is always good. We stayed in room 120 both times, and for about $120.00 a night you have a private balcony, and a king sized bed. It is less than a full block to the beach, and it is also close to many restaurants. The front desk will help with cabs, or advice. We have stayed there twice, and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: HLSTravelers
Reviews.Content: All and all my boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay but there were some things people should be aware of. We booked a room in the At Wind Chimes Inn through Expedia but when we arrived they said that our room was in their other building down the street. This other building is a new hotel that's just opening called Acadiana so there was lots of construction going on. The parts of the hotel that were finished were absolutely gorgeous and it was closer to the beach than the at wind chimes (which is only a block from the beach). Even though we were in the Acadiana, we were able to use all the amenities of the At Wind Chimes Inn. We ended up not minding the switch but if you would mind, you should confirm which building you will be staying in. The LOCATION is great! You are a block from the beach and only 10 minutes from downtown Old San Juan. It really is the best of both worlds. The neighborhood is quiet. If you go a block in one direction you hit designer shops and fancy restaurants but a block in the other direction and the area is a little sketchy so be aware of that. The FOOD at the bar was amazing! They cook everthing right in front of you. It's really fresh and just wonderful. It's not super cheap but it's not super expensive either. The bar staff is friendly and welcoming as well. It can take a while if you get there when it's busy though. The POOL is small but a nice place to relax and if you want to swim in something bigger, the ocean is just a block a way. The BEACH nearby was not that crowded and had lots of great waves. I would definitely recommend the At Wind Chime Inn or the Acadiana (when it opens up as its own hotel). I can't wait to go back myself!

Reviews.Title: “We canâ€™t imagine staying anywhere else in the San Juan area!”
Reviews.Author: Ted_and_Laura
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks, May 9 - 23. The inn was the perfect tropical oasis in an ideal location within the city of San Juan. It provided more privacy than a bed & breakfast while still giving a wonderful feeling of coming â€œhomeâ€� every night. It is a lovely white stucco Italianate villa located one block from one of the most beautiful beaches we saw in all of Puerto Rico. We felt that the inn was an excellent value for the quality, location, staff, and facilities. STAFF: The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, and generously invests their time and enthusiasm into making sure that you thoroughly enjoy your stay at the inn and in Puerto Rico. Genie took us under her wing and made us feel like part of her own family. ROOMS: Room size varies widely. We strongly recommend asking questions and reserving a particular room. We stayed in Room #121 and highly recommend it. Located on the 2nd floor of the main villa, the room was very spacious with two queen-size beds, a small refrigerator, a round table & two chairs, one six-drawer dresser, a small closet, and three end tables. Moderate-sized bathroom, not big but not cramped. Shower (no tub) was large enough for two. Two ceiling fans and an air conditioner kept the room a comfortable temperature. Three large and attractive paned windows in the bedroom, one overlooking McLeary Ave, the other two overlooking the innâ€™s pool and side street provided lots of nice light. Street noise from passing cars was moderate and didnâ€™t bother us. Room #122 was attractive & spacious with 2 beds. Room #123 had 1 bed and was a small but nice room. We felt that room 104 was way too small & dark, and we would caution about rooms 101 & 102; they were right off the lobby which can be noisy with lively conversation, sometimes late at night or early in the morning. Room #111 is off of the boat bar; it looks like a nice room but expect nearby activity & conversation. CLEANLINESS: Everything at the inn was clean, clean, clean and very tidy! POOL: The small pool is pretty as a picture and is the perfect spot for cooling off at the end of a hot & humid day. Lounge chairs are very comfortable. Donâ€™t let the posted pool hours of 9am to 6pm discourage you. As long as you are quiet and respectful, they wonâ€™t chase you out of the pool at any hour. BOAT BAR: Delightful! Itâ€™s not just an in-house convenience; the food and drinks are very good and this is a nice spot to mingle with other guests. Chef/bartender Danny shared some excellent restaurant recommendations and Freddy or Marcos steered us to a private waterfall swim in El Yunque. Room service is also available. JACUZZI/HOT TUB: One half block down the street is Wind Chimesâ€™ â€œsisterâ€� property, the Acacia Seaside Inn. Guests from both inns are free to use the facilities at either location. You MUST visit the Acaciaâ€™s Jacuzzi/hot tubâ€¦ It is something straight out of â€œSpaâ€� magazine. This long, curving rectangular pool is made entirely of Chinese granite; it is framed by several swaying palm trees. Gentle waterfalls flow in two of the corners and pretty little fountains line the granite wall on one side. At night, this oasis is beautifully lighted with soft changing colors Go to the Jacuzzi! ISSUES: The only â€œissueâ€� we could come up with is that the water temperature and pressure in the shower is quite erratic. Donâ€™t like the temperature or water pressure? Wait just a minute; it will change. We chose to approach it with a sense of humor. LOCATION: This is an ideal location! We felt safe in this lovely neighborhood of luxurious villas, beach houses and high rise condos. It is only a 5 minute drive to the upscale restaurants and shops of Condado Beach; a 10-15 minute drive to Old San Juan or Isla Verde. Only a five minute drive to conveniences such as gas stations, Walgreenâ€™s, a grocery store, and a fantastic pandaria (bakery/deli/coffee house/liquor store). Route 22, the major highway leading to points outside of San Juan, is also less than 10 minutes from the inn. If you donâ€™t have a car, there is good food and drink within walking distance, the public bus stop is just a few blocks away and taxis are available. PARKING: The inn has a tiny parking lot for a maximum of 4 cars; it is not easy to park in the lot but, otherwise, you must find on-street parking on one of the nearby side streets. Neither option is ideal but both are workable. We opted for the innâ€™s parking lot for $10 per night. If you want to park in the lot, reserve your spot with your room reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: goluboivagon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wind Chimes at the end of April (room 109). As New Yorkers we were prepared for dealing with small spaces, so we werenâ€™t perturbed by the tiny bathroom or room size. What did bother me, however, was that the room was constantly damp, and you could not open the window (it doesnâ€™t open) or the door (the bar is always full of people) to get some fresh air in. At the end of our stay there I found mold growing on my sneakers! We asked the staff about changing the room, but the options that they offered us cost additional $100. As I mentioned, the bar is right outside the window; workers come in at 7 and people donâ€™t leave til 11:30-midnight. The food prices are too high, even for those used to Manhattan price tags. Why would you want to eat in a hotel when you can walk a short block to Bebos on Loiza and have amazing, inexpensive meals? I guess, people who stay in this hotel want to stick to the familiar. Lesson learned: prior to booking the room, ask at the reception whatâ€™s outside the window. Furthermore, when renting a car, the staff hooks you up with Target â€“not the most honest car-rental place. The staff did seem nice; too bad we were eager to run out of our hotel room at 7 am and not to return til 11 at night.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: la_globetrotteuse
Reviews.Content: The reception area of the hotel is quite impressive but by the time I reached my room I was a bit disappointed. My room(109) wasn't very nice and smelt of damp. Having said that I was given the last available room in the hotel which was directly in front of the bar. This didn't bother me too much though cos I watched TV, then went out during bar opening hours. I was pleasantly surprised to find an air con regulator which is quite rare in Condado as they either have an off or on setting usually. They also sell stamps at the reception which is handy and post your postcards for you. Didn't really have any complaints about the hotel considering the price, apart from the aforementioned and it's quite possibly the only place in town you can buy a salad that doesn't cost the earth! There was one thing that bugged me though. The location, it was right on the other end of ashford avenue so a long walk to shops and restaurants but apart from that, it was fine basic accommodation for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ponsib
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wind Chimes with my wife and two children (ages 6 and 9) for three nights. There is a three night minimum stay at the Inn. We arrived for a late check-in after the pool is normally closed. The front desk woman (I don't remember her name) offered to let the kids swim as long as their voices were down. The kids loved it! I asked her if I could still get food from the "boat bar" and she informed me that the food service was closed but she then walked over with me and asked the bartender what he could make for me. She really went out of her way to make us happy. Speaking of the boat bar, one of the workers is attending culinary school and I was impressed with his attention to details and the effort he made when making and serving the food. We also had great breakfasts (the pancakes are awsome but not on the menu) while listening to caribbean music. Everyone that we encountered at the Inn were pleasant to deal with. We found it very easy to catch a bus to Old San Juan from this location. I wouldn't recommend that you take a car to this area because parking and traffic is a mess. Our room had one bed with a futon for the kids to sleep on and was adjacent to the "boat bar". It was nice to wake up in the morning and have our coffee at the small table just outside our door. The music at night was kept low and didn't bother us at all. I believe was turned off at 11pm. The room was nothing fancy but it served it's purpose well. I would stay here again if we travel back to San Juan without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, great Location”
Reviews.Author: moonshaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Windchimes Apr 11-15, 07. The location was great, the beach was one of the best I have ever experienced. We were able to easily find out the popular eating places that the locals liked and the food was great. When we traveled to the ritzy section with the five star hotels, we found the tourist were snobby, the food was TOO Americanized and not at all as good as the small dining places. If you need pomp and glitz this is not it. .We ate three brekfast at the Pueblo grocery nearby - The food was so good. And don't forget about Pinky's just down the beach for lunch and Bebos for an outstanding dinner. The Beach was not crowded and we were always able to get a nice place under the coconut trees to set up our beach chairs. The surf was a little rough but did not deter us from an ocassional swim. The Staff at Windchimes was very courteous and did all they could to be helpful. The food at the bar was excellent, drinks were great and the prices were resonable. Ask for a room off the front as the locals stay up late around the weekend and it may be a bit noisy at night - but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not Corporate and That's a Good Thing”
Reviews.Author: DurkVentura
Reviews.Content: I was in Puerto Rico for business and decided to combine the trip with a vacation. My goal was a place to sleep that was less than $100/night and â€œcute.â€� For that price I couldnâ€™t even find a Best Western or Motel 6. I just about gave up when I stumbled upon Wind Chimes. This place exceeded my expectations in every way. If you are into 10-story corporate chain hotels with huge front desks and lobbies that are bigger than airport terminals, Wind Chimes is not for you. If you are into boutiquey hotels that have a little charm but may not be absolutely perfect every day of the week, I strongly recommend Wind Chimes.

Reviews.Title: “At Wind Chimes was great!”
Reviews.Author: haley01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-March. We had a great time. The staff members were all friendly and helpful. Our room (128) was great--we had our own private balcony with a table and chairs. The walk to the beach was not too long. We also used the spa at Acacia and really enjoyed it. The room was clean. We felt completely safe staying there, and even kept our valuables (including cash) in the room without using the safe and didn't have any problems. I was not comfortable doing that at first but my boyfriend asked Jeannie at the front desk about renting the safe and she said there was no need, the housekeepers had worked there for 15 years. She was right. My only complaints about the room are that there was no full length mirror and the shower was OK the first couple of times, but by the end of our stay I was wishing for my shower at home. Just not enough pressure for me, I guess. Also don't forget to bring your hair-dryer as there is not one in the room. We rented a car and parked on the street, as it was a last-minute decision and the parking lot was full. We had to drive around the block a few times, but other times we found a spot right outside the hotel. I'd rather save the $10 a day. We had breakfast at Kasalta a couple of times and it was really good--fresh pastries. Leave the hotel and go right, towards Ocean Park (within walking distance). We also ate at the Columbo Frozen Yogurt place in Condado one morning and that was surprisingly good as well--really good Cafe Con Leche. For dinner, we ate at Latin Star in Condado (good local food), Mirabueno in Old San Juan (great food--more upscale, and we happened to go on "Opera Night" which was a neat experience), and Pamela's in Ocean Park. Pamela's was my favorite, as we went a little later (9 pm or so) and had a table on the beach. It was really quiet out there, only about 8 tables. The food was really good--I had fish, my bf had lamb. We had snacks at the Boat Bar at the hotel a few times--the mango salsa was very good. We went drinking in Condado the first night and walked back to the hotel with no problems. We took a cab another night. We also took a cab into OSJ Saturday night. We went back during the day on Monday and drove our car and parked at a deck near the Sheraton. I also gambled a bit at the Sheraton in OSJ and the Marriott and had good luck at both. Very small though, not like Vegas casinos. Overall we had a great time at this hotel and in San Juan. Like many other reviews have said, if you are expecting luxury, stay somewhere else. But if you are looking for a beautiful, cozy inn with great rates, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sassygirl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windchimes Inn for 5 days in March, 2007 and were very happy with our choice. The inn is located in the Condado area of San Juan, which is a bustling area. It would be fair to say Condado is similar to Miami Beach - very busy, a beautiful beach with lots of high-rise condos and hotels, a main strip loaded with restaurants and shops. Condado is not a quiet, laid-back "zen" place (if that's what you are looking for) but it offers great convenience for visiting sites like Old San Juan (the bus stop is only 2 blocks away and costs only $.75) and El Yunque Rain Forest (although you'll need a car to go there or go with a tour guide). We stayed in room 106 which is off the main couryard outside the pool area. Our room was furnished with a bed, 2 night stands, a full dresser (with lots of drawers), a coat rack, and a small bathroom. There was no refrigerator or anything else like that in the room. What we liked about this inn: very clean, attractive, charming, well-kept place with a very pleasing asthetic. Pretty courtyard areas with lots of tropical plants and an adorable cat whose tongue seems to be perpetually sticking out. There are also a couple other quaint public areas to hang out - little sitting areas with chairs and tables or couches that are very attractive and relaxing. There is a small but nice pool area for a cool dip. The maid service was excellent - our room always looked perfect when we returned from a day of siteseeing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The inn is located the main strip which becomes Ashford Avenue a few blocks down and all restaurants and the main strip are within a 10-15 minute walk from the inn. Guests at the Windchimes also have priveleges at the Acacia Inn which is a pretty seaside inn just down the block. The nice thing about this is that the Acacia has a BEAUTIFUL outdoor jacuzzi with waterfalls that has a view of the ocean and sitting in this jacuzzi was a highlight of our stay. I've included a photo so you can see what it looks like. I have only 2 criticisms of this inn. First - the bar. While it is a very cozy place to sit and the help is very friendly, we found the food and drinks were overpriced and of average to poor quality. A sandwich I ordered was downright terrible (overcooked, bland). On our first morning there, my hubby stopped at the bar to get coffee and was charged $2 for a cup of coffee that was probably no more than 4 ounces of coffee. Needless to say we didn't go back after that. There are tons of wonderful places in the area to dine, so my advice is to explore! On that note, our favorite restaurants in Condado were Ajili Mojili and Zabo. We had scrumptious meals at both these places (these are somewhat pricy restaurants with entrees averaging about $22-$30, but in my opinion worth the splurge). We also enjoyed having gelato at Pico Bello as a treat after dinner. My only other criticism is that there is some kind of loud generator running in the pool area that is so loud, it completely detracts from the environment. That pool area would be a wonderful, relaxing hideaway if it wasn't for that generator. I am not sure what it is, but it is loud as hell and runs continuously. So overall, despite the couple criticisms I have pointed out just for your information, I have to say that we were very pleased with the Winchimes overall and felt it was a wonderful place for the money. We would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small inn.”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota_Ice
Reviews.Content: I happened on the Wind Chimes because I needed a place to stay when my flight was delayed because of snowstorm. I didn't expect to find such a treasure. The Wind Chimes is a perfectly appointed and renovated small hotel located on the border between the Condado (ritzy, beach, and high rises) and Ocean Park (ritzy, beach, and homes). The staff were exceptional. The facility includes a small pool, sundeck, and bar that serves a limited menu for all meals. The hotel is allied with (managed by? owned by?) the Acacia Guesthouse, which is half a block away and just finishing renovations. At this time, guests are allowed to use the common facilities at either hotel. The hotel is definitely gay-friendly and probably 25% of the clientele were gay couples. My room was nicely appointed, exceptionally clean, and a bargain at $80 plus tax for a queen size bed. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: bartsbabe
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative online reviews, particularly on this site, about Wind Chimes Inn, I was somewhat hesitant to stay there. However, my boyfriend and I took a chance and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! It is a wonderful, comfortable, affordable inn that feels like home away from home. We stayed 3 nights pre-cruise and we do not have kids. Here's a rundown of Wind Chimes Inn... Location-quick walk to the beach, restaurants, shopping, and only 10-15 minute drive to airport and cruise ships. We felt very safe walking around by the Inn and neighboring homes were all well kept. Parking- did not have to deal with since we always walked or took taxis. Doors to property- require your room key to enter and exit, but not a big deal and worth it to feel safe. Front desk staff- ALWAYS helpful and accommodating. Got to know each one a little bit. Rooms-Our room was wonderful. Very comfortable, cool, high ceilings, lots of room to put our stuff. The bathroom was on the small side, but that didn't bother us one bit. Public areas- The lobby is lovely and inviting. The upstairs terrace area with the wind chimes is a quiet place to enjoy a book. The sun deck has several big comfy lounge chairs. The courtyard is a great place to meet people and read. Pool- Not heated but it doesn't need to be! Very comfortable water temp. and the perfect place for a dip. No smaller than a lot of back yard pools! Bar/restaurant- Our favorite part! We spent a lot of time here chatting with the staff and other guests. The drinks were wonderful and the food was affordable and delicious! It was just so convenient to have this bar right inside the hotel and it made meals times very easy. Contrary to other reviews on this website, the bar staff does not make any of the food on a George Foreman Grill! Several of the bar staff members are studying culinary arts and prepare your food on open flames right in front of you. All of the food was beautifully presented and delicious. Worth EVERY PENNY! Overall- we just loved our time at Wind Chimes Inn and we were sad to leave. We highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a charming, affordable, friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “reserve early”
Reviews.Author: gulfislanders
Reviews.Content: After vacating a rundown hotel, we were scrambling for somewhere quiet & clean to stay. Our first room here was outside of the bar area, noisy. The next room was beside the front desk where the phone rang throughout the night and guests departed from all hours of the night. The 3rd room was finally much better. We had to pay for the 6 nights in advance when we checked in. They were going to penalize us one night stay if we cancelled early and left, (even in the morning). The pool was lovely. The lounge chairs had gorgeous thick cushions perfect for napping. The beach is only a block away. It is only a few blocks away from lots of restaurants in Condado. The food at the bar was very good and the staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmsny
Reviews.Content: For truly inexpensive, long-weekend getaway The At Wind Chimes Inn worked perfectly myself and my fiance. The room we had was very, very small -- if we didn't stow our luggage on top of a rack, there wouldn't have been anywhere for us to walk -- BUT we barely spent anytime in our room. The beach was perfect. The hotel is situated about a half block from the beach. It took maybe two minutes to get there. The pool is also very small and the bar's food selection was a bit limited. The main strip of hotels/restaraunts is about a ten/fifteen walk. If I were to go again, I would probably cab this late at night. Overall, if you're looking for a quiet weekend getaway, I think this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hidden Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: TexasWebfeet
Reviews.Content: What a find right in the middle of the Ocean Park and Condado action! You are minutes from just about everything. The hotel is an oasis of tranquility in the center of town. Complimentary Wi-Fi, quaint little pool, terrific bar with fresh food and drink choices. I was stunned when the bartender used real fruit to make strawberry and banana daquiries! Best of all it is small so you get to know everyone quickly and it doesn't feel crowded.Definitely will recommend and return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmweaver
Reviews.Content: We have a really great stay, the hotel and staff were awesome! I loved the outdoor bar where you could have breakfast in the morning and dirnks in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 1SCREEN1NAME1
Reviews.Content: At Wind Chimes Inn was exactly as pictured on its website - charming and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was good - in the residential area of Condado, a 5-minute walk to the beautiful beach, and a 10-minute walk to the local bakery (there is an authentic bakery a few blocks east of the inn, in Ocean Park). You have to take a cab or drive to Old San Juan and to the nightlife in Condado (bars, casinos, restaurants). The cab ride to the nightlife in Condado was $8, or a 20-25 minute (sweaty) walk. We did not go to the inn bar and restaurant, but there were always people there, and we have heard that the food is good. Our room was perfect - the only one located on the top floor with the terrace. The terrace is open to the patrons, but no one goes up there. The only small downfall to the inn is the lack of parking in the parking lot - we saved $10, but had to park on a busy street a block away. We would stay at At Wind Chimes Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved At Wind Chimes! (try using the 1-800# to reserve:)”
Reviews.Author: rootsie
Reviews.Content: I need to start by saying that I returned from AWCI yesterday and the poster who made the rude comments below could have phoned the hotel directly for his reservation via the 1-800# as we did to ensure they had one. It was in fact because of my conversation with the reservation staff that I decided to book my stay there. I was so glad that I did as they, and AWCI, were among the highlights of our trip. Not sure if they were trying to book for a cheaper rate than the $99 room that they offer but trust me when I say that it was more than worth the price and there were DEFINITELY no bugs there! Now...on to my report. We found the inn to be charming and clean, and the management were absolutely fantastic! Hats off to Gabby and Juan for their help and kindness with directions, restaurant advise and anything we could think of. Always willing to help with a big smile - they made our stay! We had the cheaper of the rooms on the ground floor level right next to the bar. The private nooks and crannys of this restored casita are what made it so special. You truly felt as though you were in a cozy place miles away from the world. As you walk through the front doors into the lobby, the delicate smell of incense makes you feel as though your vacation has begun - nice touch. The room itself had 2 double beds, a dresser with TV and a table and 2 chairs, A/C and spacious bathroom. The artwork in the rooms was local and very cheerful. The floors (including inside the shower) were red tile which was really unique. The swimming pool is small but very lovely with a small rock waterfall. We used it each night when we returned from our day on the beach. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in Puerto Rico. We will definitely be back. D & CA

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable Reservation System”
Reviews.Author: willshabshis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through WWTE. WWTE is used by many travel sites such as Delta and JetBlue to book hotels. I received a confirmed reservation from WWTE stating that my room was booked. When I contacted At Wind Chimes Inn they stated that I had no reservation. After calling WWTE and them calling the hotel, WWTE told me that the hotel assured them that my room will be available as reserved. After arriving to San Juan, I called the hotel and as it turned out the room was not available and they switched me to another hotel that they own. Being cautious I decided to check out the room at a new hotel and as it turned out accomodations were totally not acceptable and the hotel was ridden with roaches size of water bugs. I would never book this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “lOVED it”
Reviews.Author: juani55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Inn and Loved it. It was clean beautiful setting to take pictures and very friendly staff. If you are on a budget I would recomend this place.
