You will not find any friendlier staff in PR. The receptionist Jeannie and bar tender Danny were great. The rooms were clean daily. Not too far from the Condado area. I would stay in this Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: cdillard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in July. I would recommend the hotel for stays no longer than three nights, and for couples/singles without children: there isnâ€™t much that children can walk to. Accommodations. Our room was in the back, past the boat bar. Accommodations were comfortable, slightly above basic. The ceiling fan made the room actually quite cool, even with the A/C turned to low. The bathroom door was slotted (like blinds) so there was almost no privacy. The shower had a curtain, but was otherwise open; the size of a tub. I agree with comments that the water takes awhile to warm up: let it run about five minutes before jumping in. The pool is small, but is great if you can snag it to yourselves (which isnâ€™t hard to do). Staff. The staff was very friendly. They directed us to restaurants, the bus stop and the Pueblo. When it came time for us to venture beyond San Juan, they assisted us with a car rental and a flight back from Vieques. The man at the front desk was very informative about the flights, ferries and car rentals, providing us with information to help make our decision about transportation to and from Vieques. The beach is just one block from the hotel, and is not at all crowded. If you have a rental car while staying here, check with the hotel first (in advance) to find out if they have a parking space available (very limited parking). If not, you will have to park on the streetâ€”and there is not much space on the street, either. For the one night we had our car at the hotel, we had to park illegally on the street, along with about a dozen other cars. There were no problems, but it made me nervous. Dining. Most of the Condado restaurants are about a mile up Ashford Avenue (which is called McLeary in front of the hotel). Beboâ€™s is a Puerto Rican cuisine restaurant a bit closer, about two blocks toward Condado on Calle Loiza. They are fairly inexpensive ($10pp) and seem to be quite popular with locals. Transportation. The A5 bus runs to Old San Juan for $.75/person each way. It picks up on Calle Loiza; ask the front desk to direct you. If you take a taxi back from Old San Juan, go to the Plaza Colon (in front of San Cristobal). There is a taxi stand here, and because itâ€™s at the edge of town, you wonâ€™t have to sit in OSJ traffic. We took a taxi from Plaza Colon to At Wind Chimes Inn and it was $12. Location. The hotel is in a residential area, about a mile from the Condado strip. We made the walk after dark, but it made me a bit nervous at times.

Reviews.Title: “not fancy; but nice.”
Reviews.Author: graceCP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at "At Wind Chimes Inn" in April 2006 ,for a total of 8 nights(7 pre-cruise and 1 post-cruise). We found the inn to be clean and the staff super-friendly. Gabby in reception was really helpful ,as well as Claudette. Juan at the bar was charming. Prices were reasonable. Although the nightlife is not exactly "booming" , it is a great place to relax at the end of the day. There is a great selection of drinks, and while the choice of food is limited, it is cooked right in front of you. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is NOT it. If you are looking for a reasonably-priced, clean hotel ,with a personal touch, then Wind Chimes fits the bill. (We paid approx.105.00 per night U.S.) The rooms are small but clean, and if you so choose you can rent the efficiency unit with a small fridge and chesterfield for more room(PRICED HIGHER AT APPROX 150.00)The towels are plentiful, the staff are courteous. The pool is small but great for a dip on a hot day. Most time is spent at the beach anyway so "who cares?" Old San Juan is just 10 or 15 minutes away by bus (fare is 0.75 cents each way). There is a great restaurant called "Bebos"that serves chicken, burgers, etc,, with really reasonable prices. Also for those who want fast foods there is a Burger King, a MacDonalds, and a KFC within walking distance (10 min). We would definitely visit San Juan again. The people are fantastic and there is lots to see and do. Would we stay at Wind Chimes again??? Without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “just "ok"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the first room we were taken to was horrible. it was next to the bar which was loud. the room was a "suite" with a kitchen. it was dark, small, and the windows had no screens. we were not happy with the room and asked if there was anything else. they took us to a much better room for the same price. it was clean and a nice size. the food was ok. the pool is really small. i wouldn't go back because of the location. there was nothing to do around the hotel. we had to take $20 cab rides to old san juan to go out for dinner and bars. the staff was nice, but that is not enough for me to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Getaway !!”
Reviews.Author: blondiejan
Reviews.Content: Very nice little place. Clean, very accomodating staff & convenient location. My husband & I booked this on line, with out any reccomendations & were pleasantly surprised. If your interested in a 4 star upscale hotel, this is not for you, try the high rises in San Juan, BUT, if a relaxed, casual experience is to your liking, we would reccomend Wind Chimes.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment....Will not return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was warm and friendly, they were not terriblly helpful or accommodating. The room was dingy and badly in need of updating. There was no door to the bathroom. The room was tiny, you could barely walk around the bed and there were no amenities. The television was tiny and the cable kept going out. The shower temperature was erratic and it took about twenty minutes to get lukewarm water. On two of the three nights we were there we were kept up by loud and rowdy guests who were partying right outside of our door. When we called the desk to complain, nobody answered the phone. When we complained the next morning the manager told us that it was spring break and we should have expected noise. There are much nicer hotels that have amenities and are near the beach. I will stay in one of those hotels the next time.

Reviews.Title: “cute place, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wtebeau
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with 2 other friends. THe room was adequate and faced the street out front. The staff was courteous and helpful at all times. This place is quaint and our room was comfortable, though I think there is a WIDE variance in room quality. I only have 2 complaints for this hotel. One, the shower was terrible. The water pressure was such that it felt like you were being pelted by 100 little needles, and the temperature was impossible to regulate. Two, the hotel is a little removed from the main strip of stores and restaurants, which meant you had a minimum 10 minute walk to get anywhere, and as much as a 30 minute walk to get to the far end of the strip(maybe longer, but that was as far my friendsand I felt like walking). As far as the housekeeping, the staff again is friendly and accomodating but they did not change the sheets one time the whole 5 nights we were there, and I doubt they ever swept. By the end of our stay, the sand on the floor was a little gross. Otherwise, everything was great, the place is cute, and adequate for a trip where you don't really plan to hang out in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Always fun!”
Reviews.Author: LatinoGuy
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the oddly-named "At Windchimes Inn" in Condado. It's a great little place with excellent service and the most agreeable professional staff ever. The annex is a little closer to the beach than the main Inn but just as nice and quite private (unless there's construction outside of your room, ask first)! People who need larger rooms (which, why would anyone want to spend too much time in their rooms in Puerto Rico?) can stay at one of the impersonal gargantuan resort hotels nearby with the casinos in the lobby. Blech. The Boat Bar in the back is great open from morning all day until about 10 or 11 I think. Theyv'e gotten more ambitious with their menu over the last year and serve quite tasty foods and often fresh tropical fruits in the a.m. The beds are comfy, the housekeeping staff great and my wife and I are going back next year! The food in Puerto Rico is spectacular, and a little restaurant near Windchimes is quite good Bebo's, but the service is SLOW! A standout is a new place called Marmalade in Old San Juan. Tantra is also recommended in Old San Juan (although lots of people know Dragonfly and others better). Migas in Condado is spectacular as well, but I would skip Ajilli Mojilli as overpriced and overated. The beaches in Condado aren't nearly as lovely as Luquillo and it's worth the 40minute trip ut there. Next time we'll definitely go to Fajardo and Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “moderte”
Reviews.Author: overniteTPE
Reviews.Content: friendly, noisy location, with small rooms, and clean facility. Moderate prices, adequate bar and quick meals. we had 2 junior suites each with bath and kitchenette. rooms vary due to location, aspect, size and amenities. Difficult to generalize about any single room. One jr suite was fine, the other not so fine. adeaqute kitchenette. okay location overall, but on a very noisy street. housekeeping and management was fine, few bugs, A/C and ventilation. stan age 64

Reviews.Title: “great value, perfect for anyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights during our spring break (we are both college students). The hotel is in a residential neighborhood 1 block away from the beach in Condado, which is a beautiful town. There are 2 buildings - one is contains the main hotel lobby, some larger guest rooms, a small pool, a sundeck, and a tiki bar/cafe. The other is on Taft St. and contains the rest of the rooms (this building is much closer to the beach). The beach near the hotel is decent and very pretty, although the waves were very rough during our stay - not great for swimming. This may have been because of the recent windy/rainy weather, I'm not sure. The beach was not overcrowded and was clean and safe, although I wouldn't recommend walking out there at night. We ended up switching rooms because of some error made at the front desk, but our 2nd room ended up being amazing. We had a huge deck with a partial view of the beach, a queen sized bed, nice bathroom, A/C, large dresser. The first room we got was not great, though, there was no deck and the window overlooked barbed wire and a parking lot, and the window didn't lock which was dangerous since we were on the first floor. Maid service was good, though, the pool/tiki bar were nice, and the people at the front desk were super friendly, fluent in English, and helpful about suggesting sights to see. The one annoying thing about this hotel is that there is no fridge, and in order to keep our drinks cold we had to walk to the main building to the ice machine multiple times per day. Also there is no alarm clock (or any clock) so bring your own. Some things we recommend are going on their El Yunque rainforest tour (the hotel makes reservations for you through a local tour company). It was only $45 which is a steal compared to other rates. It was amazingly beautiful, although it was about 1 hr away and they bring you in a tour van which is packed and hot. You get to go hiking, though, and swim in a waterfall, eat local food. There is 24 hr desk service and they can hold your bags after you check out so you can go have one last day of sightseeing. To recommend a few places to eat around the hotel, Bebo's Cafe on Loiza St. was pretty good and very inexpensive, although service was very slow and it was always crowded. No one speaks English there, either. If you walk down towards Ashford St. there are tons of restaurants there which are more touristy and more expensive. Do not walk down Loiza St. towards Isla Verde at night - it is very sketchy! If you need to get around DO take the bus, it's 75 cents and it will save you loads of money. We took it to Old San Juan both ways and it worked out great. If you want a better beach go to Isla Verde - the waves are calm and it is great for anyone to go swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJVS
Reviews.Content: From reading other reviews, it seems that the quality of the rooms can differ tremendously from room to room. I was looking at someone else's pictures on this site, and their room seems nicer, cleaner, and brighter than what we got. My husband and I chose to stay here for 5 nights because it was highly recommended by our guidebook as "One of the most charming small inns on the island." The common areas--the lobby, the boat bar, the pool--are indeed charming, but our room was quite small, worn, and dark. The furniture was VERY worn and the air conditioner was loud and blew directly on us. Housekeeping was sketchy, and we even found some dead cockroach parts in the closet. It didn't seem like the sheets were changed at all the entire time we were there, and it didn't seem like the floor was swept very well either. Our room also didn't have a bathroom door (as in, it was not part of the architectural plans), and this was rather annoying. The shower temperature was hard to regulate and the drain was clogged. The room smelled very strongly of the bathroom cleaner that they used, and we were bit by mosquitoes in the room every night. We looked into changing hotels, but Wind Chimes wouldn't refund us the money for our unused nights, and it would've cost too much to pay in full here as well as at a new hotel, so we just stayed it out. On the plus side, the hotel is very close to the beach, so it made it convenient to go every day. It's a little far from "downtown" Condado, but it is very walkable and the walk is enjoyable. The staff is friendly (although they sort of messed up our rainforest tour) and accomodating. I don't know that we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the calustraphobic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this inn from a travel guide due to the wonderful, charming ambience described. I don't know who wrote that but I'm suspicious about whether they stayed here. The room was so small that my husband and I felt like we were in a small cage. The bathroom, if you can call it that was also painfully small. And for the modest, what passes for a door to the bathroom is a door with such large slats that all can be seen and heard throughout the room. The airconditioner sounded like a freight train and though we asked to be away from the bar the noise at night was nonstop. Beyond that, there was an "Ick" factor about the place. The "Do Not Disturb" sign was filthy and the envelope left by the maid for a tip had food spills on it. Overall, it you can afford to stay elsewhere, do it. We left after one night and when we checked out found 2 other couples at the front desk complaining that their rooms were so small their husbnd's couldn't shave with comfort in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Adyan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week stay in At Wind Chimes Inn hotel in Condado. This beautiful house and the staff were just amazing! We were attracted to the hotel since we saw their well arranged website and the overall excellent reviews posted here in TripAdvisor. NOTE: Do not expect a resort or a five star luxury hotel - The Wind Chimes' service & treatment are far better than any hotel. From the moment we made reservations thru their website we were convinced this was the place for us to stay. We stayed three nights in their main building and two nights in their annex building, which is a minute or so from the main one & closer to the beach. They are indeed doing some construction (which you don't get to see since most of it is at the back of the hotel); they are sure doing an excellent job here: the rooms are beautiful, clean & well kept, plus most of them have good size balconies from where you can see part of the beach. As for their "Boat Bar" in the main building, the food is delicious and their specialty drink - the "Wind Chimes painkiller" is a must to try! Danni the bartender is great! We felt just in heaven! we are definitely going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: iron_monkey_fist666
Reviews.Content: the good: the staff was very friendly and helpful. the not-so-good: the room was very dirty-- the floors were filthy, and the bathroom wasn't cleaned-- there was hair in the tub and sink, not just a little, but quite a bit stuck in the drains. The room was very small and cramped too. Also, it's not the hotel's fault for being small and not having its own back-up generator, but the power went out twice in the span of two days, which is not fun when it's 85 degrees and you're trying to sleep at 3:00 am. We actually left the hotel at 3:00 am and went to the Holiday Inn Express. That was definitely not fun. The Holiday Inn Express was a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well it was my 2nd time staying here at the windchimes and much like the first time it was wonderful. They have re-decorated and made some minor changes but for the most part it was great. I went for my birthday with like 6 other people and I have a wonderful time. The staff as usual is pheonomonal. Maid service everday, Clean pool, Quiet and close to everything...... Can't go wrong. Gabby is wonderful. He has been there for some time now and like always he is the best. Great area, 1 block from the beach, and Private.....LOVE LOVE LOVE THE WINDCHIMES INN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sweetatlgirl
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights At Wind Chimes Inn and would definitely recommend it. The location is great, particularly if you enjoy a quiet more residential area. The Inn is out of the hustle bustle of Condado, but close enough to enjoy what the Condado has to offer and then return to a more relaxed pace back at the Inn. It is only a block from the beach and just a bit further to a nice neighborhood park. It is also close enough to walk to the Pueblo 24 hr. Supermarket and several excellent local restuarants. We found the Inn very comfortable with a nice laid back feel. The rooms were clean, great King bed - all the comforts of home. The only complaint I had was the room only had one chair, a second one would have been nice. The common areas were pleasant and we really enjoy having a drink at night out on the upper deck. It was an easy walk to Bebo's Cafe for dinner and we were completely comfortable walking back to the Inn at night. Bebo's, although lacking in atmosphere (it is a little bright) is a great value. It is definitely a local favorite, generally packed with what are obviously nearby residents - friends and families, young and old. They tend to give English menus to tourists but be sure to ask for one in Spanish as well - the daily specials are only in Spanish and they are a good deal - mostly $5 - $6. We ate there twice and everything was delicious. Cafe de Angeles on Ashford is also good - more atmosphere and an open air eating area but it is mostly tourists. However, it is quiet a walk from the Inn, but it's a great way to burn off all the Medella and Tostones. If walking isn't your speed you can always take the bus. We liked the B21 better than the A5 but be sure to have exact change (the front desk is happy to provide change) and remember you might have to wait quite a while for the bus, but it will show up eventually. The staff was friendly and helpful and I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nites At Wind Chimes. Would highly recommend it. The location is great - about 10 minutes from the airport, and 20 min from Old San Juan via the A5 bus ($.075, exact change). About 1/2 block to the beach - wide soft sand beach swept daily so it's clean. Best swimming is a 5 min walk east (directly in front of the inn the water is rougher). The neighborhood is middle-to-upper class residential; condos to the west, and art deco homes to the east. This is the land of gated driveways, beemers and Lexus, nannies with children, and dog walkers. Super safe (despite what we read about the neighborhoods elsewhere). Good local criollo restaurants nearby (something Yiho, Cafe Bebo). Small, but nice pool, comfortable chaise lounges, nice landscaping. We stayed in Room 124 - king size bed, windows on two sides (quiet side street, and overlooking inside patio). Some rooms, however, open to the bar or appear to have limited windows and views. Thought has been given to common areas (tables & chairs) so you can hang out outside your room to read or web surf. The rooms were clean - common areas could have been cleaner (or at least so my partner said). Front desk staff was great- helpful with suggestions and directions. Free WiFi access from both the front desk and bar areas (two servers) - in fact, I'm writing this from the pool right now. The off season rate for a king size bed (Room 124) was $85 - a deal! The cliente is mixed (straight and gay, Puerto Rican and North American). They serve meals at the bar (although we didn't have any). We ate breakfast twice at a local resaturant, La Patisserie - good food - good value - about a 6 minute walk west.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some problems”
Reviews.Author: bjboat
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Wind Chimes in November. The room was smallish but adequate in a nice first floor location with beautiful furnishings. The bathroom was also small but well laid out with a good shower. There was a small sitting alcove by the entrance with a table and two chairs. The Inn is attractive and completely walled. There are two locked door entrances to the property that you access with your room key. There is a small pool and a bar where they serve breakfasts and some lighter meals. There was never much action at the bar while I was there. I had breakfast there the first morning and was disappointed. I later found La Patisserie De France, three blocks away that had much better breakfast offerings. The Inn is located in Ocean Park just on the edge of the Condado. It is a four to five block walk to the edge of the Condado. The A5 bus will take you to old San Juan but it can be very crowded on weekdays and on holidays and weekends you can wait a long time for a bus. I found it better to walk into The Condado area and take the B21 bus. The Inn's location in a mostly residental area was, for me, a minus. Staff were very friendly and all in all I would recommend the hotel as a reasonably priced and comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Discovery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our first time to Puerto Rico, we looked to TripAdvisor for a place to stay. We had reserved a different place, but switched to Windchimes, and was excited to have stayed at such a great place. We arrived during a busy period, and had to switch rooms a few times. The staff was helpful, and when returning at the end of the day, our items had been moved to our new room. The beach was a few minutes away, and we had amazing views of the ocean. The pool was small, but beautiful with a waterfall. The downtown restaurant area was a short walk away, as well as a bus stop that took us to Old San Juan. We are returned Peace Corps volunteers and are very flexible. We tend to stay away from chain hotels, and the Windchimes was a beautiful place with helpful staff. Book a flight and get there soon!

Reviews.Title: “At Wind Chimes Inn, no thanks”
Reviews.Author: MaureenM618
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked 3 nights at the Wind Chimes for my birthday. We were very disappointed by our room. It looked nothing like the pictures on their website. I was very small, no clock or alarm, no bathroom door, shower was horrible (pressure and water temp). The bed was comfortable, and at least it had AC. It was located right above the bar which was not a problem because no one was ever there. It was room #128.... I would never ever stay in that room again, not worth the money at all. I will say that the location was great. A one block walk to a really beautiful beach, another short walk to the bus stop that takes you to Old San Juan & Isla Verde for only 25 cents, and also had a couple good places to eat right around. Next time I go to San Juan which I plan to do quite often ( I'm a flight attendant so I flyfor free & my boyfriend's family lives out there) I'll definately stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for the Wind Chimes Inn”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLuv2TRVL
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Wind Chimes' new property, the Acacia, which is just down the street from the Wind Chimes Inn. The room was quaint, a little small, but beautifully and tastefully decorated. The beds were plush, as were the pillows. A very comfy bed. The Wind Chimes bar was superb. It was so nice to sit back and relax, have cocktails and snacks, then hit the pool/spa. The pool is small, but it sure cools you off. The next morning, I stopped by to order breakfast. Instead of having me lug it all back to my room, they offered to bring it by. Food, drinks, and the employees were wonderful, and you really got the feel of staying at a close friend's house. Additionally, I spent two nights at another property owned by Wind Chimes Inn, Casa del Caribe. It was a bit smaller. No bar or pool; although, we were allowed to go to the Wind Chimes Inn and use their facilities. This quaint B&B had a nice veranda with a little fish pond, and a couple of cockateels in a big bird cage. It was very relaxing, and the rooms were tasteful and so comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. For example, when our flight was cancelled, they were able to accomodate us for another night. Casa del Caribe is located close to the Marriot in Condado, so we spent time at the beach bar there. Plus, there was a great Sushi place nearby, as well as an awesome tapas bar, Miro's. The prices were extremely reasonable, leaving us more money to eat, drink, and enjoy our vacation even more. I would highly recommend these two properties.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away (especially with children)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel in April 2005 with my wife and daughter hoping to spend several nights there. As we arrived at night, we discovered that the room reserved for us was facing not a street or yard but a terribly noisy bar inside the hotel. The receptionist blissfully explained that the bar was open â€œonlyâ€� until midnight and opened again at 7:30 a.m. The door to the room was also right in the bar. Although already tired, my wife and daughter said that they would not sleep in such a noise (and cigarette smoke). The desk clerk claimed that all other rooms were busy. How could this happen? I booked a room two months in advance and they assured me that I would get a quiet room. The staff offered no explanations, not to mention any apologies. Instead of going to bed, we had to call to others hotels and were lucky to find a room that helped us to forget this travesty of hotel service. A.S., New York

Reviews.Title: “Charming Chimes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Chimes. We read all the reveiews prior to booking , some not good. Our worry's were put to rest as soon as we entered the hotel. We were greeted by a super freindly staff who not only had our reservations and parking spot in order, but we were given a tour of the property so we new where everything was. We did arrive several hours early so we parked the car and proceeded to walk down Ashford Ave. A 10 minute walk gets you to a lot of great restaurants. On our return to hotel still before the 2 pm check in, we were given our room key and parking lot gate opener and was escourted to our room. It was just as the web site pictures showed. Clean and comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a laid back freindly place. If you needed anything they accommodated right away. The pool was small but very clean and inviting. The beach is only steps away, clean and beatiful. The people that gave this hotel bad marks were either expecting the Ritz Carlton or they were in a differnt place. Just a tip , if you like to retire early or sleep real late ask for a room away from the Boat Bar, however they do shut down at 11 pm at which time you can hear pin drop. We would definatly stay here again. Buce and Sue Trinka , Dania Beach Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in Puerto Rico April 14, 2005! We stayed at a guest house "At Wind Chimes Inn" that offers great personalized service. You can pay $300.00 at a larger hotel chain, but for the internet price of $99.00 for a queen size bed, you can't beat this. Realize you are in Puerto Rico and the rooms are nothing fancy, but comfortable. What makes this hotel is it's location and the friendly staff. They also have a bar just for hotel patrons and it's very reasonably priced for drinks in comparison to other places. We recommend four fabulous restaurants, each offereing the best of Puerto Rico. First, Tantra in old San Juan - the Mofongo is to die for and the Black Love Martini - a real winner in the asian fusion type cooking style. Second, Al Dente in Old San Juan - an excellent Italian Restaurant - quaint and intimate like Tantra but of course a different flavor - italian. We had the calamari with tartar sauce - it was outstanding and would have like to eat dinner there but already had plans. Service at this restaurant was impeccable. Lastly, an little Mexican place recommended to us that we absolutely loved. It's called Celito Lindo and it's on Calle Magdelene just past the Marriott J.W. and one street away from the ocean. It's next to the U.S. Post Office. At first glance and even entrance you might be a little unsure, but hold with it - fabulous food for a very reasonable price! We ordered the black bean soup and a combination plate (Number 3) and couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. Simple, but good mexican food made from scratch. Lastly, for breakfast and just up the street from At Wind Chimes Inn is La Patisserie - they have $3.99 breakfast specials each day, look for the sign at the entrance of the restaurant (lunch specials also). We ordered the standard $4.95 breakfast, but it wasn't so standard - it was delicious served with potatoes (some spice I couldn't quite figure out) and french baguette with french toast, bacon, and eggs. A real bargain and stays with you all day. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: SurfChic12
Reviews.Content: The room was extraordinarily small! we had no blanket on our bed, only a bedspread with blood on it. There is no phone or clock in the room and we would have had a GREAT view if there wasnt a building right in front of us. The pool was smaller than my own pool in my backyard. But, the location was good, just down the block from a beautiful beach and only 5 min from old san juan. Wouldnt stay here again, but it was good for the money...I mean how much time do u spend in your room in PR anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little find!”
Reviews.Author: iramcynyc
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little hotel, very safe, clean and tastefully designed and decorated. The only difficulty we had was in finding parking, but other than that the experience was very pleasant. It is a great value for the money, and if, like us, you don't like staying at big chain hotels, then this is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TimothyPT
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel and VERY close to an uncrowded beach area. A 10 min walk to where all the action is but if you prefer to stay in the heart of it all go further into Condado area (although prices can be twice as much there). The bar staff was a bit distant and unfriendly. We were often greeted by a simple "Yes". No hello what can I get you, etc. But they prepared a nice breakfast & lunch. Check-in was NOT good. We used a travel agent and the staff insisted on us providing some sort of voucher. It took a few min to convince him we do not have such a thing and he then realized it was not necessary if reservation was made through an agent. A good spot to spend the night before or after a cruise. Gay guests seemed welcome and was a 2 mile cab ride to popular dance club.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: pros: -nice 'botique' feel. quaint hotel -helpful staff; good with directions and called for a taxi when we needed one -good smoothies at the bar -terra cotta decor -if you do stay in the annex building (see below) there is a nice roof deck with a full bathroom next to it, along with a somewhat obstructed view of the ocean cons: -do not expect a resort or a large hotel with lots of staff, breakfasts, or even phones in the rooms -you may be relegated to their annex building (make sure of where you are staying) ... the annex building is a half a block closer to the beach, but it doesn't have the amenities of their main building (such as ice machine, bar-though they are building one-, front desk staff, pool) -very small pool in main building -$15.00 electricity fee (i think this may be a standard, but who knows) -small tvs (13in) -not at the 'heart' of condado per se. there is a 10 minute walk to where 'everything is' in condado, such as casinos, restaurants, little shops, etc. (a hotel like the radisson is in the heart of condado) ------- places to eat at condado: take a cab to the other end of ashford and go to the 'Waikiki' for some shell steak (eat at the back) other places: Metropol for local food (isla verde); Dragonfly for fusion food (old san juan); this lone seafood place near the El conquistador hotel away from all the rest. it's towards the seven seas beach. get the red snapper! *feel free to contact me about this hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip... Wind Chimes was exactly what we were looking for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: notravel
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and the Wind Chimes Inn was exactly what we were looking for! It is a comfy, small, friendly place. We staying for 4 days over a weekend. The building itself is attractive and there is so many plants, at night it even smelt like flowers in the courtyard! The staff was so helpful, especially Juan and Alexandra. Even before we booked a room they were giving us tons of info and good advice! It is in a very nice neighborhood, we had no problems with noise or congestion on the street... we actually thought it was a little too calm! Not to worry though a 10 minute walk will bring you to a highly populated area with stores, resturants and tourist and locals alike. The beach was only a block away and it too was beautiful, there are strong currents there though, so if youre looking for calmer waters youll need to go south a bit I suppose. The bar was great and so was the food, indeed a little pricey but what isnt these days. Danny at the bar was also very helpful with recommendations for other resturants. The room was a comfortable size or the smaller side I suppose, but if youre staying in your room in Puerto Rico than shame on you. Housekeeping kept it very clean for us and we left all of valuables in the room and nothing was disturbed. You need a key to even get onto the grounds so it was very secure. The pool was clean and warm, although small. But again youre in PR.. go to the beach!! Make sure to go to the upstairs outside louge, at night its nice and quiet with two couches and some tables perfect to hang out!! We took the bus to the city also 25 cents! And also went on a tour snorkeling and kayaking to the Bio Bay (dont miss these oppurtunities, they both were amazing). Captain Paul is one of the tour guides that works with the hotel and he was GREAT! Fun and very knowledgable. He only takes small groups of 7 and our day ended up being a totally private VIP tour. Haha it was great. If you are looking for nice, safe, even pretty hotel to lay your head and hang out, this is your place... I would definately come back to the Wind Chimes Inn and look forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shampoooop
Reviews.Content: Just took a week in Puerto Rico and stayed in At Wind Chimes Inn. Great little 22-room hotel with very friendly, helpful, well-informed staff. Bartender makes amazing Coladas! Great location, one block from beach... so no views, but excellent price. Sun deck and pool are beautiful. Overall, wonderfully charming hotel. I very much recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. We just came back from Puerto Rico and managed to squeeze one night at the WindChimes. The only problem I found is that when you try to make a reservation online or over the phone, they demand you reserve for 3 consecutive nights. However, once I was there they were able to accomodate us. I got a guest room with all the ammenities that I needed. It's not luxurious, but for the reasonable price you get a clean room, fresh towels, clean sheets, and cable... The bartender was great. She gave us suggestions of the hot spots in old San Juan. The staff was very helpful and the security of the place was top notch. You needed a key to come in and out of the gates. I would recommend this hotel, especially for single women. It's 5 minutes away from Isla Verde and 15 minutes away from old San Juan. There are several places to eat within walking distance. The pool was of good size, however, it was a bit chilly to dip in.. It's February..... Try Bebo's Restaurant, is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel... and enjoy typical Puerto Rican cuisine... Also, try the bar at the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “worst experience in PR”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The wind chimes was the worst experience I had in PR. The service was unprofessional, demeaning. The facilities are under par. It is a facade. On the outside it looks quaint. The reality is that the rooms are small and dark. The service.... well the lack of service was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven night stay at the beautiful Wind Chimes Inn. What a great place! Location was perfect just a block away from the open beach of Condado. With only 22 rooms the hotel is very peaceful and personal. The staff must rate amongst the most profesional and attentive at any hotel I've ever stayed at: perfect, helpful, and pleasant: Yuan, Murcia, Lynette, and of course, Gabby -always smiling. Their recommendations on restaurants was accurate and excellent. Their special treatment made us feel right at home. They sure do an excellent work on operating this hotel - on duty 24/7! The room we stayed in was perfect, the bed was perhaps the most comfortable of any hotel bed I've ever slept in. There was a lovely terrace with a small fountain where to enjoy some quiet reading and cocktails. I absolutely loved this hotel, and we agreed that we will never stay anywhere else in Puerto Rico again. During our stay, we encountered so many other guests who were enjoying their stay as well. Some were staying at another building down the street called the annex (or was it the akacia?), well, in all they loved this annex. I heard some of these rooms have balconies with a nice view. We would ask for these rooms next time. After a long day's sightseeing or shopping the courtyard boat bar is a joy to come back to for a cool, relaxing drink away from the madding crowds! Ask Dany or Rafy for a painkiller or a frozen margarita. Their service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: juju32
Reviews.Content: If I ever return to Puerto Rico, I would definitely stay at the Wind Chimes Inn again. A block from the beach, with beautiful well kept grounds and neat clean rooms. What made the stay so wonderful here, was the service! The front desk attendants were pleasant and always suggested great places to go at night & helped us get cabs to take us to our destinations. And the bar service where they can make food and drinks, Wow! The bartenders were both very nice and made us great drinks (watch out for the 151 Rum!!!) they poured our drinks in to go cups when we wanted to return to the room, and the food they made was phenomenal! We ate omelettes every morning prepared fresh in front of us and tasted great. We also had snacks when returning from the beach, which were fresh and tasty as well. Our room was always clean with extra towels, and we never had to ask for more. Overall, a wonderful inn, compared to other places of this size I have stayed at elsewhere, this one is a definite must.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Puerto Rico and we learnt the day of arrival that the staff at Wind Chimes Inn had lost our reservation and could not accommodate us, even though I had called in 3 weeks before arrival and they had confirmed our reservation. When I made my reservation (months ahead) I asked them to send me an e-mail with the reservation details. They did not. When I called 3 weeks before arrival, I asked them to send me an e-mail with the reservation details. They did not. Net result, we arrived in San Juan without a place to stay. Found the staff to be horribly rude and unprofessional when we talked to them over the phone. I dont like to put up with such prima donna like behavior on my vacation, and especially when I'm paying for it!!! THANK GOODNESS for the Andalucia, a couple of blocks down the street from the totally unprofessional Wind Chimes Inn. Small, clean place with tasteful decor. Reasonable prices. Above all, professional and friendly proprietors who strive to please. Hope to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pekkleloca
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on August 2004. It was a really great place to stay. The people were very friendly, we especially loved the bar! Great drinks and food! The room was always clean and the people were always ready to help. Just a few blocks away from the beach. If we were to go back to San Juan we would defenetely stay there again. We highly recommend it....

Reviews.Title: “coming home”
Reviews.Author: papoulos1
Reviews.Content: I stay @the wind chimes inn it was like coming home. they treat it me like familyand was helpful on all resturant and night life will stay again and again I love the hospitality of a small hotel and is very safe area

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Guest House in Ocean Park”
Reviews.Author: still-Wandering
Reviews.Content: The only thing negative I can say about this place is that it's not on the beach. Big deal! The rooms are big and clean, nicely furnished and well maintained. The staff was wonderful and very helpful in planning side trips. Yes its on well-traveled McLeary, but who cares; it was clean and safe. Some reviewers questioned the safety of the neighborhood; nonsense, its safe (unless you like to play in traffic). If you like small hotels, this is your best buy in Ocean Park.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Wind Chimes from Nov. 14 - 27, 2004. I booked on-line and there was no choice in rooms. Upon arrival I asked for an upgrade and we were accomodated the next day. We stayed at the additional house which looked to be still in progress 1/2 block down the road > closer to the beach. Rooms were somewhat small but very clean and nicely furnished. The bathromm was also in good condition. Both rooms were kept in imacioulous conditions by the cleaning staff during our stay. The gated doors of that house were kept closed (guests had a key) and we felt safe and comfy there. We checked out the breakfast bar twice. The first time was great. A German lady most efficient and very friendly served us a sumptious breakfast. On our last morning, our second breakfast, it was a little less uplifting > mix-up in the order, missing food item, food came at different times for my husband and myselve etc. We were served by 2 people of which one said he didn't do the breakfast bar for a while and the second one spoke Spanish only and was just given instructions. So Ok Breakast bar was soso. Parking is a problem. Not many spaces and you have to make reservation otherwise you find yourselve circleling the blocks. The pool was a dissapointment. It looked nice in the pictures but turned out to be just a little more than a bath tup. The staff at the reception/concierge desk was fantastic. Always extremely helpfull and really friendly and sincere. Thumbs way up for these ladies. THANK YOU!!! To the neighorhood. At first it looked a little run down which it was. But for the people in the stores and restaurants they were warm and friendly to us tourists and made us feel ok and safe. No problem there. Buses are readily accessable and a bargain for 25 cents just one block off the hotel. No need for taxis. The beach looked nice and clean and hardly anybody enjoying it at the time we were there. For somebody who doesn't like the hype of the big hotel chains this hotel is perfect. It's clean, quite, private and everything is easily accessable. Also, Puerto Ricans are special people. Respect and kindness is in full swing. That's what we have experienced at our stay at this lovely island. My husbad and I are 48 and 54 years young of mixed race and culture and like to do things our way especially on our vacation. We hate to be put on a schedule or box, or told when to do and what to wear or being insulted or disrespected by other guests or anybody or anything for that matter. PEACE

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smdnyc
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nites at the Wind Chimes. Staff very helpful, rooms nice (but small) and a little bit of a walk to restaurants in the Condado area. The area the hotel is in (at the edge of the Condado) seemed a little desolate at night. The way the hotel is set up makes it very conducive to interacting with other guests at the bar & pool. Make sure you ask to be in the main building, there is an annex building as well. Overall it was a positive experience and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A ringing success”
Reviews.Author: gastup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Wind Chimes for three nights prior to a cruise departure and found the accommodations to be very nice. Our room was clean and comfortable. It's a uniquely attractive inn and while the pool was far from large it made for a great cool evening dip. The staff was very helpful. It arranged a rain forest tour for us and offered a great tip for breakfast at Kasalta, a local restaurant a few blocks from the inn. As advertised, the inn is just a short block from the beach. Generally, this place earns high marks. Figure 30-40 minute bus ride to Old San Juan. But who's complaining at a 25-cent fare.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dear friends, I stayed on August 2004 at the Wind Chimes Inn for 4 days and I did not like it at all. First, the indications given to get from the airport were so poor that it took us a long time to reach it. Then, nobody opened us the door for about 15 minutes. The girl at the front desk was not there for unknown reasons. We were given a tiny room with an even smaller bathroom where only one at the time may enter.However, the room was always neat and clean.We had views to a patio. The parking area was not easy since you had to approach your car to a wall in order to let the other 5 cars enter their way to their place. Not to mention the horrible and dirty swimming pool available. Besides, when we wanted to change the hotel for our second stay at San Juan, we were charged one full night!!!!! It was unfare!!!!!! I do not recommend you this hotel!!!!! There are million better in Condado Area!! I Â´d rather recommend our second hotel "The San Juan Comfort Inn"--nice rooms, nice pool, breakfast included in regular price, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: sunnytrees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I staid 2 nights before our cruise and things were great! The staff was great, as mentioned and that means a lot to me when traveling! Downfalls: rooms ARE small, the "tiki bar" IS overpriced, I agree a continental breakfast would make up for this and the pool hours AREN'T great. But being from the US, if I am in San Juan, Puerto Rico, I'm not hanging at my hotel. So, that being said, I think the $110 we paid for our decent sized, clean room with a bathroom and tv was WAY better than spending $250/night at the Marriott as some other people we met had. And better than the $60-$80 we could have paid for SCARY places!! I wouldn't spend a week here, but for a few days, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: clm2006
Reviews.Content: There is a lot going right at Wind Chimes. My family and I were there for 13 days. It's a lovely place, lots of charm and intimacy, beautiful physical plant and the people running the place (Gaby especially, who was so accommodating to our needs and helpful with advice about where to eat and how to get here or there.) are fantastic. The location can't be beat. A four minute walk from the beach and at the perfect spot to pick up the central highways on the island. There are great restaurants within walking distance (Bebo's, Kasalta) and if you don't have a car, public transportation can be picked up close by as well. I felt safe there...but I wasn't in the annex, which sounded a little fishy to me when it was mentioned when I first called. It's not completed and I think they're using it eariler than they should. Here's what could be better at Wind Chimes: pool hours are too short (9-6); the pool is TINY! Literally four people max can move in that space. And as for the jacuzzi, uh...it's more like pool pumps that you can press your back against. ANd the last two days we were there, the pool was developing a disturbing cloudiness that no one seemed to see fit to apologize for or explain. There is no complimentary breakfast...even continental could do the trick, especially when the place bills itself as welcoming for kids. A family can't plunk down 8 bucks a day for a bowl of cereal and a glass of juice, which is what you'd spend at the "Tikki Bar" at Wind Chimes. The room attendants make the beds and refresh towels, but don't reliably sweep the gritty sand that inevitably comes in on your sandals, nor do they re-supply the shampoo unless you ask. There's no iron in the room, which one might need if one were doing business on the island and needed pressed clothing. They supply beach towels, but could think about renting out beach umbrellas, especially since they bill themselves as having access to the beach. One cannot just sit there and roast all day without serious damage taking place. The parking facilities are horrible. There are about five spaces and you have to park about an inch from a wall in order to fit, so if you're not ready or able to climb out of the opposite door, you're stuck. I'm getting a little too crickety to have to climb out of a car. So, the bottom line is, it's a cozy, reliable, safe, convenient, and pleasant place to stay in PR. I'd stay there again if I needed to. I'd recommend it to people. BUT, I will look around for another place in the Condado area for the next time I head to Borinquen--just to see if there's something better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here if you can afford not to..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! We were very disappointed after so many glowing reports and recommendations. The first big problem was the parking. We paid extra for a reserved parking spot and the parking lot turned out to be a tiny area that looked like an alley. We spent the week maneuvering in and out with the other cars hoping not to hit a wall or other car. You are forced to back out of the alley onto a busy street.We had reserved what was supposed to be a renovated room (Like those on the website). The first room they showed us had broken tile on the floor, paint peeling in the bath, a tiny TV, and a window which would not close (not good for the bugs). The second room they gave us was even smaller (Think walk through the door and hit the foot of the bed) but in a bit better shape.Though we downgraded, we weren't offered a lower price or any apology. The showers were nothing more than a corner of the bathroom with a shower head covered by a curtain. It wasn't particularly clean or quiet. It was a bother to have to open a lock to get OUT of the place! The pool closed at 6 p.m. (when you'd like to get IN). Don't go by the website--we were surprised at the exaggerations. Not a wind chime in the place! But for the price we paid, about half of what we'd have paid at a large hotel, it was OK. Didn't feel particularly safe but not in danger, either. The staff was friendly. I saw that you should make VERY CLEAR what kind of room you want and be ready to accept the bare bones. The beach was gorgeous but the walk there is through a seedy neighborhood. If you have the money, go elsewhere . If we go back to PR, we will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good but is it safe?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed the ambiance,friendly bar staff, close proximity to a beautiful beach, and general cleanliness of this boutique hotel, but were surprised and saddened to have a bag full of souveniers stolen from our room. The rooms and front gate all have the same key in the newly renovated annex (as does the main hotel ) but the annex has no security at the gate. Our room also had no phone in it, and the light in the hall was out and was never fixed during the 5 days we stayed despite telling them numerous times.The manager and staff were considerate and showed concern regarding the theft but ultimately did nothing ( not even a complementary drink!) about it. The bar/restaurant is very good for a kitchen that consists of a George Foreman grill and refrigerator, and the concierges were helpful with reservations etc.Your stay in San Juan should be a safe one,so be on your guard and don't leave valuable in your room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wind Chimes Inn this past April. All of the hotels and condos were booked so we couldn't find anything and this was the only place that had any vacancy. Lucky for us, or else we would have never known about this place. The hotel is small, quaint and cozy. So if you like those big crowded resorts, this is not the hotel for you! The atmosphere is permeated with a rich incense smell that gives it an even more homey feel. In fact, it feels just like a big house, with its personal touches of art and those quirky turtle shaped lights on the steps. We got the junior suite that had its own terrace and made us feel like we had our own wing. It was not fancy by any means, with its wicker furniture and basic amenities, but it was clean and comfortable. The decor was bright and tropical, and the art reflected the local flavor. The staff was very helpful, especially when I needed new linens at 3 am, thanks to my son, they really took good care of me. My old linens were taken by housekeeping early the next morning, from where I had laid them to dry on the terrace. We had a nice visit with some friends on that terrace and it felt like we were at home. The pool, albeit small, felt like our very own pool. It wasn't crowded with rowdy children; in fact we were the rowdy ones in comparison to the quiet sunbathers and novel-reading sun lovers. The courtyard is adorable and really added to the bed-and-breakfast feel of the small quaint inn. The only downside is the lack of parking and the difficulty in getting in when you first arrive but that is for our own safety, so I could deal with that. Plus it's close to town where we could walk and get anything we needed. We did our laundry and picked up some odds and ends. It was close to Bebo's, where you could have a nice, affordable sit down meal. It was close to anything you needed, really. I preferred walking as parking was at such a premium, once I found a spot, I didn't want to move my car. However, the area was very secure and the car was safe. We loved it here so much that we are going back on our return visit in October. No matter what, we said, we had to get in at least one night at The Wind Chimes. I'm recommending it to everyone who wants a recommendation on a nice hotel, that feels like home without the frills and expense and crowd of a big resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very overated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel because of the good ratings on trip advisor but it was just a disappointment. I travel constantly and stayed in hotels 214 days of 365 last year so I have seen few hotel. Firstly, to try and get into the hotel is like trying to get into a house with no one home. There is a bell at the front and you ring it and then a voice asks you who you are and if you sound ok they let you in. Secondly, it is a very pokey hotel and the staff seem very wary of you having a look around. I asked if I could have a look around and the resopnse was "why do you want to look around the hotel?". Thirdly, I went for the junior suite at $135 a night(the most expensive room) and the room was small, a double bed, no telephone or internet connection, a 14 inch TV, the bar fridge is empty, room service was not available. After I saw what the hotel was like(it was 4pm at this time) I asked if I could see another room for which the response was "the hotel is fully booked and this is the only room" so I asked to cancel my reservation and go to another hotel and they charged me the first night which with taxes was US$150 - I should expect this but it was still annoying. I went to the Courtyard Marriot in Isla Verde and it was very good in comparison and only cost US$176+taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel On Condado”
Reviews.Author: Scohn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the At Wind Chimes Inn from June 15-23. This small hotel is an oasis in San Juan, with a staff that is among the most friendly and welcoming I have ever met. We came from Chicago with our 2 children (10 and 16) and the staff gave us a great rate on two rooms (one queen bed one with two double beds) for staying the whole 9 days there. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. They certainly weren't fancy, but quite reasonable and the beds very comfortable. The original art in the rooms is also a very nice touch. The location was excellent. It was convenient to the beach (1/2 block from a great section of Condado beach which was never very crowded with great soft sand and warm and inviting water) as well as only a short walk to a 24 hour grocery store (we kept a small fridge in our room for fruit, water, and snacks - at a small additional fee). It also had excellent access to the highways and busses. We rented a car for a week of the trip, and although they were out of reserved parking spaces we usually could find a spot to park on one of the two blocks next to the hotel, and never felt any security problem parking there. The small pool was very calm and relaxing, and despite its small size was great for us as we were the only people using it on every occasion but one. They also have several small decks for lounging and some nice plants and a charming deck with a number of wind chimes. They also have a nice bar which also serves breakfast and lunch/dinner plates. But more than the nice rooms and charming and relaxing atmosphere, it is the staff at the Wind Chimes that truly deserves credit. The people at Wind Chimes are friendly and helpful at every moment. They are extremely conscientious and would always provide guidance with places to go, directions to get there, and help you organize your travels. From restaurants to tours, towels to postcards, there was never an unmet need or an unhelpful staff person. From the moment we entered the hotel we felt at ease and at home. They really show you the true meaning of Puerto Rican hospitality. Clearly this is the not the spot to go if you looking for one of the fancy hotels with luxury spotless rooms and a casino in the lobby. However if you are looking to stay at a really convenient place with a wonderful and welcoming staff, a relaxing and refreshing atmosphere, at a very reasonable value, then this is a great place. I know it made our stay in Puerto Rico that much more memorable and enjoyable, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn from June 10th to the 13th and would go back! Our room was small but had everything we needed. It was clean and very pretty. We loved the tiles on the floor and the colorful decoration, the smell of candles and the music when you walked into the lobby. We spent most of the day out around the island, so when we came back at night, everything the Inn had was more than plenty. The pool is small but good enough for cooling off after a hot afternoon. One very important thing, if you plan to rent a car, pay the extra $5 for parking becuase it is hard to find parking around. They have only 4 small spaces for parking so make sure you make arrangements. We did this and were glad we had a place to park every night.

Reviews.Title: “happy customers”
Reviews.Author: dlpickup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't have been happier about our stay at Wind Chimes. We booked our 3 night, 4 day trip to SJ, PR spontaneously knowing we didn't want to stay in a big, cheesy resort. We pulled up to the inn and knew our research lead us in the right direction. Wind Chimes is staffed by kind people, is perfectly clean, cozy, and ideal for a quick, semi-no-frills getaway. It rained a bit everyday during our stay but that didn't stop us from going to Condado beach, sitting at the pool, exploring Old San Juan, and wandering in the SJ Art Museum. We had all our breakfasts at the inn - delicious. Our most memorable meal was at Pamela's (EXCEPTIONAL). We ate on the beach, feet in the sand style, and couldn't have asked for better food or service. All in all, we had a wonderful get away and Wind Chimes was a great place to rest our heads after days at the beach and exploring.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our room on line. We checked in. First of all, there was someone elses luggage in the room.( the person changed room) It was not real clean, it smelled like urine, The bathroom was dirty, and we found roaches in the room. Needles to say we checked out that same afternoon. Lucky for us there were rooms available at the Ambassador, it saved our vacation

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windchimes from April 22, 2004 thru April 27, 2004 to participate in a wedding. This hotel has provided excellent memories for myself and others, I met people from all walkes of life here, and all of them were very kind, some had been comming back to the Windchimes for years and I can see why! It's cozy, warm and very personal, I felt like this hotel was built with comfort in mind , and the food is good to, one of the best things, I met 2 couples that were also attending the wedding Toni. Dan, Matt, and Jennifer, we all became great friends and look forward to getting together. One this is for sure we all would come back to the Windchimes. WARNING!!!! Stay away from the Marriott in Condodo they dont like people from the states and they dont like our $$$$$$ trust me on this one! In other words if you see the Marriott RUN! Back to the Windchimes and dont pass it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, beautiful, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A beautiful time at this inn again. yes i said again. would stay no where else in san juan area. the rooms are comfortable, clean. the staff is beyond belief. very helpful, personable. this is where you go to feel at home on a tropical island. a great tour program. thank you paul. i went kayaking at the age of 50, and no i am not a fitness , workout kind of person. but i did it. you cannot believe the comfort i feel here when i come back. try it you will be very pleasantly surprized at the gem you have discovered. one block from a beautiful beach and stores close by. Yes try Bebo's for wonderful puerto rican fare at very reasonable prices. can't wait to go back! keep number 5 open for me. to Ute, who i can say made my trip all the more enjoyable, keep doing what you do so well!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Puerto Rico in over 20 years. Most of my family has died or moved out of the island.I didn't want to spend a lot in visiting. But I didn't want to spend it in a shanty place. I found Windchimes on the net. It doesn't offer the luxury of an expensive hotel. But it offers something more special. It offers the privacy and the feeling of being in your own home. The staff is very willing to satisfy your every need and whims. And the location of the inn is in the very heart of Puerto Rico. Near every thing that is important. I stayed for two weeks and wished I could stay for more. I highly recommend this inn to anyone who wants privacy and personnel care. Will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Last Puerto Rico Night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for our last night in Puerto Rico. Our room was darling, comfortable, clean, quiet and spacious. The staff was helpful and friendly. The Inn is conveniently located near the beach, and airport. I completely agree with the other rave reviews. We are trying to get a room for our last night again this year, but the secret is out and they may be booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took a cruise with our two college age daughters and stayed three nights precruise at Wind Chimes. We had a great time, the hotel is very quaint, the staff was helpful, the boat bar was fun and we always felt very safe. We also hired a tour quide that we'd highly recommend and he was very reasonably priced. Jerry was just a very fine personable, fun young man. He picked us up in the morning and we spent the whole day exploring El Yungue, the caves and the highlight was the bioluminescent kayak tour. He'll give you a list of options for the day and you choose what sounds interesting for you. You can email him at -------------.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Inn, Good Price, Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Windchimes Inn is a good deal for the price. The Staff is fantastic - friendly, accomodating, and helpful! The boat bar is a nice perk - we had breakfast there every day - very convenient.The room was fine - it was slightly small, and the bathroom shower could've used retiling and a really good scrubbing, but it wasn't that bad. Overall the Inn is very cute, with several nice deck areas and a small pool. It's about a 10 minute walk into Condado - there's a few restaurants, hotel casinos, and bars there. We were there on Thursday and Sunday nights, and there was NO ONE in the bars. In general, we were disappointed with the San Juan nightlife, in Condado AND in Old San Juan. Apparently there are a couple good Techno clubs, but as we don't like Techno we avoided these. Our best evening was at the Parrot Club in Old San Juan - fantastic restaurant with great atmosphere.Windchimes is a short walk to the beach, which is nice. Isla Verde, which is a $10 cab ride has lots of lounge chairs and beach bars/restaurants - a little more going on than the area directly in front of the hotel.We ended up taking taxis a lot, which added up, as we searched for a more lively neighborhood.Basically if you're looking to relax in a reasonably priced, cute place to stay with a fantastic staff, windchimes is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Just Our Speed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Wind Chimes for 4 days during the last week of February and found it just perfect for our needs: eating, drinking and lying on the beach. Not the most ambitious agenda but sometimes that's what vacations are all about. If you're looking for a hotel that is a perfect base for this type of vacation, Wind Chimes is the place to be. Its the kind of hotel where nothing is spectacular but everything is just right, especially the staff - they helped us with excellent restaurant recommendations and taxi service every day. BTW, we were hooked on the tapas bar at the Hotel Convento in Old San Juan. If you go, say hi to Rafi the bartender and get him to set you up with a few of his signature mojitos - you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a safe residential neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Adams
Reviews.Content: The inn is like a garden apartment in a residential neighboorhood. Lots of places to relax. Easy access if you want to sight see. A car is nice but public busses are just fine. Driving is okay everywhere but Old San Juan and during rush hour. Bring your own shampoo and hairdryer and request the larger rooms ( King suites) for a little more money you have a fridge and microwave and two rooms. Very helpful staff and great small personal tours with Paul . We stayed at another place for twice the price and didn't enjoy it as much as windchimes. We'd go back and spend longer there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with friends coming off a week in Mayaguez and then she and I were going on a cruise out of San Juan. We loved this Inn. The staff were so friendly and went the extra mile to work out our requests. We had an unusual parking situation which they bent over backwards to accomodate. We also had laundry we needed cleaned before our cruise and for $20 had everything done by that same afternoon. The Boat Bar was a great place to hang out during the day or evening. It sits in a kind of courtyard area where the seats at the bar are protected but just behind you is open to the sky. We loved sitting there during lunch as it rained for a brief period...very cozy. The food at the bar was good and the drinks excellent. We didn't use the pool as we were not in the mood, but the beach is only a block away and very nice. Our room was large with a king size bed and a nice size bathroom with a large walk-in shower. I noticed a few comments about the hot water, but we had no problem at all taking hot showers. There are a number of nice eating places nearby, from local cuisine to American fare. Shopping is available too within walking distance. We intend to stay here again. It is the perfect place to fly into a few days early before a cruise as it sits between the airport and on the way to the cruise ships. If you have any questions email me at bob007@mac.com.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Beauty”
Reviews.Author: BARDESS
Reviews.Content: Going to San Juan for an escape from a New York winter, I stumbled upon Wind Chimes. What a marvelous find! First of all, let me say that if you want the Hilton or meaningless glitz, go somewhere else. I happen to love small inns and this one was just marvelous. Yes, the rooms are small, but the whole place is small! Big deal. It is very clean, brightly decorated with original artwork, and the staff is exceptional. It is right on the street, so you do hear traffic, but I live in New York, so that was normal! The Boat Bar, their little bar/restaurant is wonderful - if the weather is bad, or you don't want to go out, you can just eat in. There are all sorts of lovely touches, including that if you want to leave your luggage there after check-out and zip down to the beach, you can do that and then come back for a quick shower before leaving for the airport. The inn is between two strips of fancy hotels, so the beach is less crowded. Bus to Old San Juan is two blocks away, and it's 25c. Is this a five-star hotel? No - but they deserve a 5-star review. I will certainly be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kjh5475
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in mid October. It is a nice, quiet place with a friendly and helpful staff. The only drawbacks I noticed were that the water pressure wasn't the greatest and there was no shampoo in the bathroom. No big deal... I just walked down to the dollar store a few blocks away and bought a bottle for $2 and I was fine. I will definitely be staying here again when I return to Puerto Rico. Please feel free to email me if you have any specific questions about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved At Windchimes!”
Reviews.Author: mringenoldus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming Inn on our return from a week long cruise. After being with large groups of people, the Inn was a welcome respite. Our room wwas at the front of the second floor and quite large. It had saltillo tiled floors and cherry yellow floral and pale blue accents. The pool was small but had a nice little waterfall. My daughter's room was above the back of the Inn. It waas a little smaller but had a large sun porch with comfortable furniture. The boat bar was a big hit with everyone and staffed by a very pleasant young lady. The Windchimes is very clean with spotless white walls. The was a very welcoming scent throughout the lobby from either candles or incense. It was also very secure in that it has a front courtyard gate. The front desk will issue you the key. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

HotelInfo.Name: At Wind Chimes Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1750 McLeary Ave, San Juan 00911, Puerto Rico
